Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/Elements-Pl.title: Elements Placement Suggestions Table
Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/Elements-Pl.content:
Elements Placement Suggestions Table §















































ELEMENTWHY PLACE ITWHERE TO PLACE ITHOW MANY TO PLACECUSTOMThese are specific Elements that you want to be possible in your Events. The more you know about the Situation the more Custom Elements you’ll likely place, although you don’t have to place any if the Category is mostly unknown to you.Custom Elements are likely to be placed throughout a List, with the most common in the 1-10 slots, less common in 11-15, and the most rare in slots 16-20.Place as many as you want, space allowing. Each Custom Element represents a specific thing, so the more you place the more you define this Category.EXPECTEDThis Element represents what you would expect to happen for this Category in an Event. You can fashion the expectation as you play, shaping it based on the adventure Context. The Expected Element is helpful as it allows you to fill out your List without having to come up with more Custom Elements.You might want to place some in the 1-10 slots, representing early Events being routine in nature. Having a few throughout the rest of the List can help balance the Category out.The Expected Element gives relevant detail to your Category without having to rely entirely on Custom Elements. Most Lists should probably have at least 4 Expected Elements in them.NONENot every Category needs to be represented in every Event. The more None Elements present in a List the more likely that Category won’t show up in an Event.Any part of the List where you think the Category would be less active.The less active a Category is the more None Elements it should have.SPECIALThis Element usually modifies another Element, shaking up the List a little.This Element is best situated in the middle or later portions of a List where it can modify Elements after you’ve had a chance to have some Events first.The Special Element should be rare, appearing at least once to add extra variety to a Category but no more than 3 times.RANDOMThis Element is a middle ground between Custom and Expected, allowing you to generate an interesting and unexpected Category Element as you play.Place it later in Lists with lots of Custom Elements to represent the unknown, and earlier in Lists that have few Custom Elements when you need Random Elements to generate specific results.The fewer Custom Elements you have the more Random Elements you may want to consider to add variety to your Category List.CONCLUSIONOnly include this Element if the Situation has an end.This goes in the first Category List near its end. The further down the List you place it the longer the Situation is likely to last.You only need this Element once. However, you can repeat it if you want to shorten the duration of a Situation

Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/Event-Speci.title: Event Special Elements Table
Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/Event-Speci.content:
Event Special Elements Table §









































1d100Result1-10INCREASE: Roll in the Category again (if you get Special treat it as Expected). When interpreting the Element in this Event increase its intensity, making it something more than you would have.11-20DECREASE: Roll in the Category again (if you get Special treat it as Expected). When interpreting the Element in this Event decrease its intensity, making it something less than you would have.21-30THIS IS BAD: Roll in the Category again (if you get Special treat it as Expected). When interpreting the Element in this Event treat it as something unfortunate or negative for the Player Character.31-40THIS IS GOOD: Roll in the Category again (if you get Special treat it as Expected). When interpreting the Element in this Event treat it as something fortunate or beneficial for the Player Character.41-60MULTI-ELEMENT: Roll twice in the Category (if you get Special treat it as Expected) and include both Elements in this Event.61-70MOVING ALONG: Add 3 Progress Points to this Category instead of 1 Point for this roll. Otherwise treat this as an Expected Element.71-80ROLLING BACK: Subtract 2 Progress Points to this Category and don’t add 1 for this roll. Otherwise treat this as an Expected Element.81-100RANDOM ELEMENT: Treat this Special Element like a Random Element, rolling on your choice of Meaning Tables twice and interpreting the results.

Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/General-Flo.title: General Flow
Crafter-Series/Event-Crafter/General-Flo.content:
General Flow §
When to use it §
In any situation where an evolution/expansion over time can be useful.
Examples:

Like for Location Crafter, can be used for expanding locations.
Faction actions that increase in gravity with time (Fronts).
Trap generation with increasing difficulty.
Generator of quests (bounties but also general inspiration).
Etc

Flow §

Define the situation and how many categories it can have (from 1 to infinite, but 1-3 should be enough usually).
Define Categories (each will have its own list copied from Event Crafter List). PP starts at 0.

Is it Structured? Completely defined, like standard Location Crafter
Randomized? Partially defined, like Randomized Location Crafter.


For each category, define elements accordingly. See Elements Placement Suggestions Table for guidelines.

If Structured, place Expected, None, Special, Complete etc elements as necessity. Unique elements are possible too (crossed off after use, skipped in counting the rows when rolling).
If Randomized, define Known (by Character) or Wanted elements (by me). Unique elements are possible too (crossed off after use, skipped in counting the rows when rolling).


During play, when the situation should generate an event (exploring a new area if exploring a location, or when the situation should come into play occasionally (the faction makes a new action, a trap is encountered, a quest is needed)):

Roll on all Categories for that Situation.

If Structured:

Roll on each list 1d10+PP of that list.

If rolling over the list, consider Expected and subtract 6 PP instead of adding 1 PP.


Interpret results. Refer to Event Crafter Elements Reference for predefined elements explanations.
Increase PP once per usage of list (not per roll).


If Randomized:

Roll 1d10+PP on Event Elements Table first, choosing the desired column.
If 1d10 List or 1d10+PP is rolled, roll on the Randomized list accordingly.

If rolling over the available list, choose which one makes more sense or roll again.






Once all results are there, interpret them together for this generated Event.
Return to step 4.

1D100Result1-10SUPERSIZE: Roll on the Area Elements Table again (if you get Special again, treat it as Expected). Whatever Element is generated, enhance it as much as possible. Make it more intense in some way.11-20BARELY THERE: Roll on the Area Elements Table again (if you get Special again, treat it as Expected). Whatever Element is generated, minimize it as much as possible, making it less intense.21-30THIS IS BAD: Roll on the Area Elements Table again (if you get Special again, treat it as Expected). Whatever you get, it is bad for the Player Characters and interpret it that way. This may be a dangerous encounter, a trap, or something that is simply broken and unusable. Whatever detail you generate give it a negative interpretation.31-40THIS IS GOOD: Roll on the Area Elements Table again (if you get Special again, treat it as Expected). Whatever you get, it is good for the Player Characters and interpret it that way. This may be a helpful encounter, a way out, or useful object. Whatever detail you generate give it a positive interpretation.41-50MULTI-ELEMENT: Roll twice on the Area Elements Table (if you get Special again, treat it as Expected), and combine both Elements into the Area together.51-65EXIT HERE: This Area, in addition to whatever else it contains, also holds an exit from the Region, if this is possible. Maybe it’s a back door out of the mansion, or another exit from a cave. If this result makes no sense, ignore it and treat this as an Expected Element.66-80RETURN: Whatever else this Area contains, it also has access to another, previously encountered Area in this Region. This is only possible if that other Area had a way to reach this one such as doors or access that the Characters had not yet explored. Choose the connected Area that’s most logical. If this result makes no sense then ignore it and treat this as an Expected Element.81-90GOING DEEPER: Treat this as an Expected Element. Instead of adding one Progress Point for this Category add three instead.91-100COMMON GROUND: Treat this as an Expected Element. Eliminate three Progress Points for this Category (don’t record the Progress Point for this Element and eliminate two more).^RLCSpecialTable

Woods Generator §
Dark Woods: Forest with dark, evil energy.
Ancient Woods: Normal forest, dense and unpredictable.
Horror Woods: Horror take on Dark Woods.

Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/Asoth-(Sober)-.title: Asoth (Sober) Nakaly
Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/Asoth-(Sober)-.content:
He is one of the old guard of Seekers, now trying to keep supplies going at The Haven while keeping factions from killing each other with copious alcohol and always keeping a good group of Seekers at hand to quell any animosity.
Asoth become a Seeker for unknown reasons, being very quiet about its past before the Cursed Kingdom. Some whisper that he was some kind of nobility, driven off their lands by false accusations.
Since his arrival here, he made a name for himself as a reliable Seeker, helping in capturing the castle now known as The Haven with a fellow group of adventurers, The Wolf among them.
After this, he decided to fortify it and open it’s inn The Haven, that gives the castle its name.
He often says to Seekers, that to keep factions sober from blood, he needs to keep them drunk with alcohol, hence his nickname.

Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/Bandit-King.title: Bandit King
Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/Bandit-King.content:
Not much is known about this cruel person.
Most lower level bandits never see him, keeping himself in the The Lost Forest Hideout, away from prying eyes and protected by the dangers of the Cursed Kingdom and its own loyal followers.
His growing paranoia regarding the secret of his hideout keeps his group safe but this mental stress is greatly weighting on his psyche, which is pushing him to ruthless executions and manhunts at the minimum suspect of treason or lack of unquestionable loyalty.
This behavior is reducing his circle of advisors, which are feeling increasingly at risk of his wrath. Real treason is brewing and a mutiny seems to be the right path for many of them. The irony…

Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Commander.title: The Commander
Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Commander.content:
The person commonly known as Commander, is the appointed leader of the Wardens of the Kingdom from its founding kindom in the Outside World.
He is a middle aged man, hero of many battles before being sent to lead the Wardens.
He has a deep disgust for the creatures twisted by the Kingdom and rarely leaves the The Fortress, focusing mostly on strategic movements of Wardens and investigations in how to find an end to The Spire and its Emissions.
What only the most high ranking members of the Wardens know is that the Commander has been sent here as punishment for failing a coup against it’s King. To avoid losing the symbol of the war hero he represents, he has been sent here, with its personal guards also doubling as prison guards for him.

Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Guide.title: The Guide
Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Guide.content:
The Guide is the leader of the Archeologists. She is a very determined elf, a magical user with great experience, focused on co-living with the dangers of the Cursed Kingdom to discover more about the magical laws of nature and how to invent new ways to better the life of everyone.
Such high ideals have in multiple occasions put her at odds with The Commander and his Wardens of the Kingdom.
She is not a type to be stopped by morals, resulting in many unsettling choices during the years, especially towards experimentation on captured subjects or by willingly risking the life of her Archeologists to investigate dangerous places.
Her main objective is investigating The Spire to somehow understand the Wild Magic Emissions and find a way to brindle their power to her will.

Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Wolf.title: The Wolf
Cursed-Kingdom/Characters/The-Wolf.content:
The Wolf is a veteran Seeker that has taken to heart the training of new arrivals at The Village, distributing commissions and other possible jobs to newcomers, trying to match them with more experienced Seekers and minimizing risks to life for all in the process.
She is highly respected for this and has become one of the the facto leaders of the Seekers.
She came into the Kingdom many years ago, in the hope to make a quick buck from selling Residuum before going on and continue her adventuring life.
During this period she came to love the dangerous area, respecting the wild side that nature could take here and being fascinated by it.

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Anomalies.title: Anomalies
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Anomalies.content:
They are the wildest parts of a Wild Magic Field. Hotspots of wild magic, ready to unleash on whatever disturbs them.
They accumulate magical energy that is released violently if someone or something interact with them, be it some falling foliage passing through them or a distracted traveller with short to live.
They are usually hard to see, visible only by attentive eyes searching for heat distorsion-like movements in the air.
After unleashing energy, Anomalies return active after a brief moment.
These Anomalies tend to manipulate the same energies of the parent Field they are part of. So a Heat Wild Magic Field will have cracked earth all inside it, high air temperature requiring some specialized protection and Anomalies of various type. Some could explode in a fire ball upon being touched, others could emit a stream of fire in a random direction for a few seconds, others still could be randomly becoming extremely cold or extremely hot at more or less regular intervals.
After a Wild Magic Emission, they usually fade out and reappear a while later in different numbers and locations inside the same Wild Magic Field area.
Many Seekers search for them while walking inside a Field by launching pebbles and other small objects in front of them, hoping to trigger the Anomaly to spot them. Unfortunately not all Anomalies are visible once triggered.

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Curse.title: Curse
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Curse.content: The Curse is the mix of residual energies that are left behind after a Wild Magic Emission happens from The Spire. They disturb the magical fields that go throughout the world, causing normal spells to become dangerous and unwieldy.

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Light-Crystals.title: Light Crystals
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Light-Crystals.content:
Light Crystals are a useful tool for many Seekers in the Cursed Kingdom.
They are small irregular shards of a transparent crystalline material, mined from a Wild Magic Field near The Ark which produces it. They are usually kept on necklaces but are also refined as ring jewels or other decorations at the owner’s taste.
Almost everyone keeps a least one on themselves, due to their usefulness. The Archeologists sell them at a basic price, since they consider them essential for the survival in the Kingdom.
They provide a various list of benefits:

They provide protection for a few hours upon entering the White Hell, after that, they discharge and become inert and opaque;
They stabilize low power spells and other simple arcane and divine channelling of energy without risking wild magic effects;
Around 1 minute before a Wild Magic Emission, they turn red to urge the owner to seek shelter.

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Residuum.title: Residuum
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Residuum.content:
Often materials of any type fall in Anomalies, resulting in burnt, electrified, squished pieces of dirt, meat, metal and rocks littering Wild Magic Fields.
Sometimes, the magic of the Anomalies and the Field react with these materials, infusing them with tremendous amounts of energy.
The result is Residuum. A twisted, distorted object glowing with near endless amounts of energy and with special, magical properties. Often dangerous, but always sought by Seekers, the Cult of the Curse and many other factions of the Cursed Kingdom.
These objects are searched by the Outside World wizards for good sums as well, since many of them enable strong rituals or substitute magical components without being expended, proving invaluable for magic practitioners.
Some wizards in the Cursed Kingdom even collect them to stabilize and empower their spells.
Residuum Object Generation §
You can generate a Residuum Object effects on the Magic Item Descriptors, Powers or Spell Effects, Scavenging Results Meaning table. It’s physical appearance can be determined by the Objects Meaning Table. In any case, the Action Meaning Table 2e and Descriptions Meaning Table 2e can also be employed.
Some Residuum protects from the same element from which they were created, others improve the body and mind of the wearer, while others give spell-like abilities, immune to the magical instabilities of the Kingdom.
Each object found should have some benefits but also some disadvantages, proportional to the beneficial effects. Only beneficial objects are possible, but should be rare and highly prized and searched.
Following is a list of possible objects that can be found:
TODO

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Ruined-Magical-L.title: Ruined Magical Laboratory
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Ruined-Magical-L.content:
Before the Curse, the Kingdom and his last King were greatly focused on magical research. This led to the creation of many locations where experiments were made, all scattered in the Kingdom. Many have been found or were not hidden at all, uncovering creatures born from these terrible experiments as well as strange and wondrous magical objects.
Many are still hidden and sealed still, requiring extensive search to find their entrances and a way to unseal them.
Hidden knowledge §
All unsealed laboratories were public and minor ones, without many ways to safely close them to external eyes. These laboratories are today only ruins, plucked for loot and knoledge decades ago and often left to the foul creatures of the land.
An unknown number of them were instead more advanced and sealed themselves the day of the Curse. Some have been found, others are still lost but all have resisted all efforts to open them. Sometimes someone finds a key or a cave-in uncovers a way inside. In the rare cases Seekers entered and left those laboratories alive, great riches, pre-Curse magical objects, knowledge and new horrors were added to the Kingdom.
Unsealing a laboratory §
Finding a way inside a laboratory should involve an investigation into the key or magic word needed to unlock the giant circular metal doors that lock them.
Maybe a clue can be found on the carvings of the door. Maybe an ancient deposit has the key, but it’s under the control of another faction. In any case, the effort to unseal a laboratory can lead to an adventure in itself!
Event Crafter Lists §
Situation: Exploring a Magical Laboratory §
When entering inside a Laboratory, this Event Crafter list can be used as inspiration and basis to be personalized.
When a Laboratory is encountered for the first time, you can roll on the Action Meaning Table 2e and Descriptions Meaning Table 2e, Locations, Curses, Dungeon Traps, Dungeon Descriptors, Mutation Descriptors or Powers Meaning Tables, based on the Context.
Each Laboratory was focused on a particular area of magical or alchemical study and that should be chosen upon entering it for the first time.















































































































































LocationsEncountersObjectsPP000TypeRandomizedRandomizedRandomized1Lab FeatureSeekersAnomalies2WildlifeHistory clue3Mutated InhabitantsLab Feature4Mutated WildlifeResiduum5Experiment ResultExperiment Result67891011121314151617181920
Locations §
Lab Feature §
This result means that the location found is linked to the main function of the lab. Maybe a research on some peculiar metal was carried on? Some kind of smeltering equipment is found.
Encounters §
Experiment Result §
A result of Experiment Result means that the main product of this laboratory is encountered. This can be a creature, mutated decades ago and kept alive by the magical systems. They can have animalistic instincts or be more intelligent and capable of speech… if they don’t hate you.
Objects §
History Clue §
Not much is known of a specific laboratory before entering it. This result means that some clue about its original function and/or what has happened in the decades since opening it is found. If inspiration is needed, rolling twice on the Descriptions Meaning Table 2e, Legends, Mutation Descriptors, Objects, Creature Descriptors or Characters will provide some words regarding characters, creatures, objects or situations about them.
Lab Feature §
Most laboratories were focused on studying some specific aspect of magical energies or creatures. This led to each of them having some peculiar structure or device, be it unique or defining the entireity of the structure. Maybe the entire laboratory is built with magical energy channels going thorugh it, or maybe a big containment structure defines a place to keep large or dangerous creatures. This Object can be large enough to define the entireity of the location, become some kind of “location” in itself. If possible, this result should be merged with the Location result, but if it doesn’t make sense, give more importance to this result to better accentuate this laboratory’s unique features.

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Wild-Magic-Emiss.title: Wild Magic Emission
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Wild-Magic-Emiss.content:
These terrible and magical events are started roughly every 1-2 days from the The Spire.
At the beginning, a strong thunder is heard in the sky, announcing the arrival of a new Emisison. The cloudy sky pulsates from a strong reddish light, that colors everything.
After a minute, a magical shockwave starts propagating from the Spire and reaching in a few minutes the borders of the Cursed Kingdom. In its wake, new Residuum objects are created in the Wild Magic Fields.
If caught outside by this magical shockwave, a creature is killed or, rarely, randomly transformed by chaotic magic. All creatures need to find cover inside buildings, dungeons or caves. Any kind of physical barrier of a few centimetres and covering the view of the sky is enough to provide a safe place.
Even mutated creatures and wildlife know instinctively to seek refuge when this happens.
Keyed Scene: Emission Incoming §





















DescriptionTriggerAfter 1 day from the last Emission, during each Scene Bookkeeping, ask a Fate Question: “Does an Emission start?” with odds calculated as Very Unlikely and increased 1 step for each number of the Counter. On Yes and more, this event is triggered and the Counter resets to 0.EventAn Emission will start during the next Scene.Counter0

Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Wild-Magic-Field.title: Wild Magic Field
Cursed-Kingdom/Concepts/Wild-Magic-Field.content:
These places are the most visible results of the Curse, usually occupying a few tens of meters of land, but capable of reaching several kilometres in radius, like for White Hell.
In these locations, the magic field is wild and unpredictable, modifying the basis itself of reality in many cases. They range from relatively safe areas of slightly higher or lower ambient temperature, to dangerous locations where gravity, cold, heat, psychic energies or acids, to name a few, can kill an unfortunate traveller in mere seconds.
These locations are generally traversable by expert Seekers, staying stable in the same place for years.
Although there are hot spots of even wilder magic that lashes out at victims if unadvertedly interacted with, called Anomalies.
In these Fields, Residuum objects are created and found. Thanks to that, these dangerous places are explored by many factions, sometimes even defended and surrounded by makeshift walls, avamposts or barricades.
Notable Fields §

A couple near The Village. TBD
The Haven Field.
The Ark Crystal Field.
The White Hell

Event Crafter Lists §
Situation: Journeying a Wild Magic Field §
In case of larger Fields, this Event Crafter list can be used as inspiration and basis to be personalized.
When a Field is encountered for the first time, you can roll on the Action Meaning Table 2e and Descriptions Meaning Table 2e, City Descriptors, Curses, Dungeon Traps, Dungeon Descriptors, Mutation Descriptors or Powers Meaning Tables, based on the Context.















































































































































LocationsEncountersObjectsPP000TypeRandomizedRandomizedRandomized1SeekersAnomalies2BanditsEdibles3WildlifeField Feature4Cult of the CurseResiduum5Mutated WildlifeDead bodies6Mutated Inhabitants7Wardens of the Kingdom891011121314151617181920
Locations §
The location list is empty by default, due to the high variety of Fields, but once the nature of the Field has been identified, some expected locations should be added.
Encounters §
Usually all factions and creatures can be found in a Field. This list can be adjusted to fit specific Fields though, maybe in your version of the Cursed Kingdom, Mutated Wildlife will not enter a particular type of Field.
Objects §
Field Feature §
When this is rolled, a peculiar characteristic of the Field will be found. It should be themed after the field the Player Character is exploring.
Residuum §
A Residuum object is found.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Archeologists.title: Archeologists
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Archeologists.content:
This group is often composed by Seekers that have developed a deep curiosity of Residuum and how these magical objects can bring innovations and a better life to the Outside World. Many are also sages and researchers, who want to uncover the secrets of this magical phenomenon.
They do this by employing Residuum in the creation of magic items and tools of great utility, trying to better the life of everyone, without borders, like the Light Crystals.
They also begrungidly work on commission from Outside’s nobility as well, to provide specific magic objects or some other rare item found in the Kingdom, usually to secure funds and materials to help them in the Cursed Kingdom.
They try to find ways for Residuum to better the life of the lower classes and removing power from nobility, often by collecting recipes for creating new magic items gained from the study of Wild Magic Fields and often using parts of Residuum objects.
Notable NPCs §

The Guide

Relations with other factions §
As everyone else, they are in open war with the Cult of the Curse and Bandits.
Also, they are at war with the Wardens of the Kingdom due to the opposite approaches to the Cursed Kingdom. Even if the military might of the Wardens is well above theirs, their control of the production of Light Crystals keeps them safe from direct confrontation at The Ark.
Relations with Seekers are usualy good enough to occasionally collaborate on missions that require some mercenary work from them, mostly for grunt work like escorts or carrying materials or informations.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Bandits.title: Bandits
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Bandits.content:
As always in the world, some people try to do honest work, whatever that would be, while others try to steal that work from them. The latter type are called Bandits in the Cursed Kingdom.
A practical name for a group of individuals that prey of the risks of other factions, mainly Seekers, stealing hard won Residuum and other ancient treasures from their discoverers and trafficking it to the Outside World, usually outside legally recognized channels by the neighburing Nations.
Notable NPCs §

Bandit King

Relations with other factions §
This eterogeneous group of lowlifes is at war with all other factions, but especially with Seekers, that they love to target for easier stealing than the more politically involved factions.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Cult-of-the-Curs.title: Cult of the Curse
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Cult-of-the-Curs.content:
This group is as heterogeneous as mysterious.
No one knows where they start their attacks from or how someone can join them. They attack everyone on sight, screaming threats against the “heretics” and ignoring personal safety to seek and capture all intruders, which in their point of view seems to be eveyone else.
They worship the Curse itself, seeking to protect it from the tainted touch of the Outside World. They are more numerous in the inner parts of the Cursed Kingdom, usually protecting big or important Wild Magic Fields, White Hell or, more than anything, The Spire, from which the Curse originated.
Captured individuals are impossible to communicate with, seeking every occasion to escape or kill themselves by starving or other, quicker ways. No one has ever managed to communicate with a captured cultist, receiving only non-stop threats and insults.
What is known about them, is that they don’t sleep, don’t seem to suffer for this deprivation, can navigate istinctively Wild Magic Fields and Anomalies, also Mutated Wildlife and Mutated Inhabitants ignore them.
Notable NPCs §
Unknown.
Relations with other factions §
Attack on sight with everyone. Only the Cursed Kingdom itself seem to consider them allies.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Mutated-Inhabita.title: Mutated Inhabitants
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Mutated-Inhabita.content:
Many at the time of the Curse got horribly transformed in twisted and perversed versions of themselves. Many barely recognizable and with a shattered mind. The Curse, in it’s perverted cruelty, has given many of these unlucky people an unnatural long life.
Other Mutated Inhabitants are instead more recent addition, maybe from Seekers caught by a Wild Magic Emission, or someone lost in a Wild Magic Field for a long time and succumbed to the subtle influences of it.
Most of them have unique characteristics, but for all something is common: their mind is twisted and cruel, always hunting for intruders of the Cursed Kingdom. Some act in more animalistic ways, others with a deeper intelligence. All use their powers
Creating a new mutated inhabintant §
If you have a clear idea of a possible inhabintant, that’s perfect, continue your story!
Otherwise using The Creature Crafter or rolling twice on each of the Creature Descriptors, Creature Abilities, Animal Actions, Mutation Descriptors and Powers tables, stopping as soon as you have a clear idea in your head. This approach should generate Inhabitants more alike to Mutated Wildlife.
A different approach instead to get inspiration would be to “approach” it from the Character side, especially useful for more intelligent Inhabitants. In this approach, you roll twice on the Characters, Characters Descriptors, Characters Appearance and Characters Skills.
After you have an idea of the Character that was, before the mutation, you can search the monster that is by rolling twice on the Mutation Descriptors, Powers and Spell Effects tables.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Mutated-Wildlife.title: Mutated Wildlife
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Mutated-Wildlife.content:
Most of the Wildlife that can be found in the Outside World has disappeared, usually twisted and transformed in strange, bigger or sickier versions of the original animal by the influence of the Curse.
Most of this flora and fauna has developed means of defense in this dangerous place, with some very unsettling powers.
Plants that spit acid on anything that approaches, or lives in symbiosis with smaller animals to act as ambush spots.
Animals with disproportionate limbs, capable of great strength or resistance to the effects of magic spells. Some even employ basic forms of magic manipulations, for example becoming covered in magical fire without taking damage or creating illusory copies of itself to fool preys or unlucky adventurers.
Creating a new creature §
If you have a clear idea of a possible creature, great! Go ahead!
Otherwise using The Creature Crafter or rolling on the Creature Descriptors, Creature Abilities, Animal Actions, Mutation Descriptors and Powers can help give inspiration.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Seekers.title: Seekers
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Seekers.content:
Few individuals try to risk everything for a better life like Seekers do.
Everyone adventuring in the Cursed Kingdom is considered one.
They are a group of independent people who enter the Cursed Kingdom from the Outside World in search of the fabled Residuum.
Most of them manage to scrap by, collecting the most common ones and selling them back in The Village, for many the first and only safe haven on the edge of the Kingdom.
Some instead try to go deeper, explore the cursed land for rarer and more valuable treasures and Residuum.
They are usually neutral regarding the Kingdom and how other factions want to approach Residuum, being more interested in surviving, bringing some coin back to family in the Outside World.
With time other factions grew from this heterogeneous group, depending on how their relationship with the Kingdom, or other Seekers was. From here were born the Archeologists, the Wardens of the Kingdom and the Bandits. Some say even the Cultists of the Curse were once reasonable Seekers.
Notable NPCs §

The Wolf

Relations with other factions §
A part from Bandits and Cult of the Curse, with which they are in open war, Seekers enjoy reciprocal neutrality with other factions, from which sometimes they receive some mercenary work.

Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Wardens-of-the-K.title: Wardens of the Kingdom
Cursed-Kingdom/Factions/Wardens-of-the-K.content:
They are an organization created years ago by one of the kingdoms in the Outside World with the mission of destroying the Curse.
Their members are in good part of military origin but have started accepting Seekers in their ranks too, if they reach a good level of trust.
Their main objective is reaching The Spire and finding a way to undo the cataclysm that happened there.
They consider themselves the only protectors of the people and the Outside World from the dangers of the Cursed Kingdom.
Their internal organization resembles that of an army, with The Commander managing and coordinating missions from their HQ in the intermediate part of the Cursed Kingdom.
Notable NPCs §

The Commander

Relations with other factions §
If possible, they are the most hated faction by the Cult of the Curse.
They consider Bandits as scum that must be arrested if possible, killed if necessary. Captured bandits are usually escorted to the Outside World to face trial, or so they say.
They tolerate Seekers for the need of supporting mercenary work, but they consider them intruder on what is a de facto military zone.
Open war is present with the Archeologists instead, thanks to their opposite views and approaches on the Kingdom.

Cursed-Kingdom/Introduction.title: Introduction
Cursed-Kingdom/Introduction.content:
First of all, thanks for reading! I hope this campaign setting will bring you many adventures and joy, be it by playing it solo, in co-op or in traditional social play with a GM. So, let’s get started!
This document outlines the Cursed Kingdom, a complete campaign setting with a dark fantasy inclination. Depending on your choices though, you can easily personalize the tone towards high fantasy, OSR-style loot delving or some other fantasy subgenre. It mainly depends on which elements you will choose to focus your story.
What you need §
This setting is mainly designed for use in solo or co-op roleplay, specifically by using Mythic Game Master Emulator Second Edition while playing it on the fly, with zero preparation (a part reading this document). This setting can be used with any other oracle or system, but some tables are specifically made to be used with Mythic and assumes its use. With other system some adjustments might be necessary.
I also recommend and assume the use of other resources by Word Mill Games, specifically the Event Crafter, introduced in Mythic Magazine #24. This can be replaced also by the Randomized Location Crafter (Mythic Magazine #2) or the original Location Crafter. This last one will require some modifications to the lists to add Expected, Special and other standard Elements that are randomized in the other two versions.
This resource is not strictly necessary though, since all locations will contain enough descriptions to play without them, maybe using some meaning tables or oracle question from your favourite system.
Another one are the Keyed Scenes from Mythic Magazine #10.
Spoilers? Don’t worry about them §
Before playing, I recommend reading through all the setting, to better understand what is present and the mood of it. Since the adventures will be generated while playing, there is no risk of spoilers. For example, you might know about the existence of the Cult of the Curse faction, but their presence in your story is not even a guarantee!
Attribution §
This work makes use of Mythic Game Master Emulator, Event Crafter, Keyed Scenes and Randomized Location Crafter, all by Tana Pigeon, published by Word Mill Games, and licensed for our use under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0) license. Find out more at www.wordmillgames.com.
The Cursed Kingdom §
The Cursed Kingdom is a fantasy setting with a dark undertone. There are dangerous locations to discover, wondrous objects to find and many factions to interact with.
This setting is designed for a solo character, but it’s easily scaled up for a group.
No specific RPG system is assumed, so all dangers and challenges can be scaled up or down as well, based on your personal preference.
With Mythic, your adventures will find their flow, starting with one of the Starting Seeds provided (or even starting from scratch) and continuing on their own from there.
That said, happy reading and…
Good hunting, Seeker.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/Cursed-Kingdom.title: Cursed Kingdom
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/Cursed-Kingdom.content:
What is today the Cursed Kingdom was decades ago a flourishing reign of progress and magical advancement, encompassing a lot of today’s Outside World as well.
One day, decades ago, a terrible cataclysm originated from what is today known as the The Spire, tearing a hole in the fabric of the magic energy that permeates the world.
This cataclysm is today called the Curse, and influences a roughly circular area originating from the The Spire and extending for a few tens of kilometers of radius around it, encompassing also the Capital of this reign, today known as White Hell and by far the most dangerous place in the Kingdom.
Inside the old Kingdom area, magic goes haywire, complicating the casting of regular spells and producing Wild Magic Fields, which have created a new gold rush for Residuum objects for magical researchers, collectors and kingdoms, these last ones born from the ashes of the Cursed Kingdom.
Wild magic has mutated plants, animals and peoples alike. Some of the original inhabitants still roam this lands, their flesh and minds distorted and mutated, searching for life to destroy and to protect the Kingdom.
Old Magical Research Laboratories are distributed throughout the old Kingdom, some are already plucked ruins inhabited by horrors or wildlife, while others are still hidden and sealed from the outside, ready to be rediscovered.
Seekers are the only people crazy or courageous enough to venture inside this area, always searching for Residuum, old forgotten treasures and, for some, shelter from the Outside World’s laws and prejudices.
With time sub groups have formed, divided by different opinions of the Curse and its byproducts, but all have in common the need to survive for the next day.
Among these groups, the most prominent are the Archeologists and the Wardens of the Kingdom.
The first group aims to study the Curse and Residuum, considering them a boon for the people in its tragedy.
The second sees them as a dangerous fenomenon to stop and The Spire as the main objective to reach and destroy to save the world.
Among these, Bandits try to steal and raid their way through them, while the Cult of the Curse tries to clean the Kingdom of the presence of any heretic that doesn’t see the Curse as the gift from the gods they believe it is, which for their standards is everyone but them.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Ark.title: The Ark
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Ark.content:
The Ark is the main stronghold of the Archeologists. It’s a flying cargo ship, full of studying equipment and alchemical substances that the magic researchers use.
The Ark is rarely moved, usually only in emergency situations or if something needs to be studied closer by the Ark crew itself.
While on the ground, the ship is surrounded by wooden fortifications and other obstacles, mostly to provide safety and more living space with other quick buildings hosting support equipment and dormitories. Expensive alchemical laboratories and other hard to move equipment is kept on the ship, ready to fly at a moment’s notice.
Residuum-wielding magic users keep guard, mostly from wildlife attacks, since the Wardens of the Kingdom wouldn’t try an attack against an easy to move base.
The researchers at the Ark also provide a daily bulletin for Wild Magic Emissions, to provide warning to all other avamposts with a few minutes of warning. These messages are received by Light Crystals, which turn red when an alarm is issued.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Fortress.title: The Fortress
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Fortress.content:
The Fortress is the main stronghold of the Wardens of the Kingdom, in the inner part of the Kingdom.
This black stone fortress showcases the military capabilities of this group. It’s a large complex, built from a pre-Curse keep and expanded upon ever since.
This location is the main starting point for Wardens expeditions in White Hell.
Location §
Its black stones come from a process of refinement that the Wardens apply to normal stone using Residuum techniques, giving them immunity to magical manipulation in case of sieges, which only happened once.
Only Wardens are usually admitted there, but Seekers are also often seen there for shelter and mercenary work. The Wardens endure their presence to provide support in raids, Residuum requisition and Ruined Magical Laboratory searches.
Resources §
Most of the resources to keep the fortress going come from outside the Kingdom with military provision convoys, heavily guarded by soldiers and Wardens alike.
In extreme cases, a convoy from The Village has also provided needed help in case a regular convoy was lost to the Curse.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Haven.title: The Haven
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Haven.content:
The Haven is the innermost stable avampost of the Seekers in the Cursed Kingdom.
Due to the difficulty of keeping avamposts safe in the inner zones, the Haven has become with time neutral grounds between all factions, which share this place keeping an unstable truce.
This avampost is usually the starting place for expeditions to White Hell and other Wild Magic Fields.
Location §
The reason the Haven is kept safe from the dangers of the Kingdom is thanks in no small part to the well preserved walls of the castle that once was here, on top of a hill overlooking the surrounding lands.  Today most of the castle is just badly preserved ruins, with some improvised reparations to keep walls up and the head dry, especially from Wild Magic Emissions.
Each of the factions (Archeologists, Wardens, Bandits) keep a section of the castle, while the veteran Seekers and Asoth (Sober) Nakaly keep the central section, to minimize contact between the warring factions.
A nearby Wild Magic Field, called The Bouncer also keeps many dangers away. In this Field, creatures ages a lot faster, reducing a person to a dusty skeleton in a few minutes. This barren patch of land cover one side of the Haven’s Hill, simplifying its defense considerably. Markers are placed all around its perimeter to make sure all avoid it.
Resources §
All supplies are sent by small caravans between The Village and the Haven regularly and Asoth (Sober) Nakaly is both the only merchant and the only innkeeper here. Adventurers sell their Residuum and any other loot to Asoth, to avoid a dangerous trek back to the Village, financing the Haven in the process.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Lost-Forest.title: The Lost Forest Hideout
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Lost-Forest.content:
The headquarters of the Bandits is located in the middle of a subtle Wild Magic Field, unknown to everyone, minus the most trusted by the Bandit King.
The Lost Forest §
This Wild Magic Field encompasses a forested area in the inner part of the Cursed Kingdom. Most expert Seekers avoid it, preferring doing a longer round around it to reach the White Hell.
The main feature of this Field is the subtle mind alterations that act on all that comes inside, modifying or erasing their memory of the road walked inside of it, making it impossible not getting lost and possibly dying of hunger in this dead and pallid area.
With time everyone and everything dies among the trees and a lost wanderer will often find corpses of their predecessors in varying states of decomposition.
The Anomalies that are created by this Field are usually what causes these mind effects, completely invisible to the eye but emitting a faint smell of rotting corpses when getting closer.
A way to survive is known to only a few selected by the Bandit King himself.
The rare Residuum produced by these Anomalies are the only objects capable of shielding the wearer from their effects. It’s rareness is also accentuated by the active effort of the Bandits in finding and hoarding them in their hideout, so that the Bandit King is able to control access to only the most trusted collaborators to his hideout.
The Hideout §
The Hideout is the secret residency of the Bandit King and the center of coordination for Bandits’s attacks.
Originally was an old hunting lodge in the forest, which was expanded to become a big complex of mostly wooden buildings with a walled perimeter. Here can be found barracks, dormitories, kitchens and storage buildings for stolen Residuum and other objects found in the Kingdom.
With regular cadence a convoy departs towards the Outside World to sell the goods on black markets, kept hidden from prying eyes by some Residuum objects that hide their traces.
No faction has still found how the Bandits have contact with the Outside World.
To keep all these secrets, the Bandit King keep the Hideout location known only to the necessary people, seeking and killing everyone that betrays him and everyone known to be in contact with the traitor.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Spire.title: The Spire
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Spire.content:
Many historians think that The Spire is where the Curse originated.
It’s located near the borders of the White Hell, but still outside the limits of the old capital city.
This ominous structure is the place from which Emissions originates, but no one seems to be able to reach it alive. Menacing stormy clouds circle around the tall structure, covering the rest of the Cursed Kingdom in a perennial stormy weather, forever locked in a cold Fall season.
In the past, many groups of expert Seekers have attempted to reach it, only for some of them to be seen after months as mindless creatures of hunger and violence, their mind shattered and contorted beyond salvation. Some say that a safe route exist from the White Hell, but no searcher has ever found it yet.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Village.title: The Village
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/The-Village.content:
The Village is the name commonly used to refer to the relatively safer zone towards the edge of the Cursed Kingdom where a small town once stood.
Today, this forgotten settlement is the main point of entrance and resting place for many rookie Seekers and some veterans in search of some relative peace from the inner areas of the Kingdom.
Even if this is considered a safer place by many, thanks to the absence of heavily mutated wildlife and lesser Wild Magic Fields in its immediate sourroundings, deaths in the area are still high compared to the Outside World. It’s not rare to find corpses destroyed by Anomalies, with its remains picked by wildlife in the near sourroundings, probably some rookie Seeker with too much confidence.
Among the ruined stone and wooden buildings, many improvised refuges are present. Some small subterranean sections have been excavated in the years under it, to provide shelter during Wild Magic Emissions and protection against Bandits attacks.
The main merchant, Sidorivik, is famous for his low offers and high prices, but pays very well for found Residuum.
The Wolf is the de facto leader of the town, keeping supply runs going to The Haven and training novice Seekers when they arrive.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/White-Hell.title: White Hell
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/White-Hell.content:
The Ancient Capital §
Before the Curse, this was once XX Name TBD, the Capital City of the Cursed Kingdom. Flourishing and at the center of a sprawling empire, a few millions of inhabitants called it their home.
The Curse §
Decades ago, a cataclysmic event destroyed the entire civilization of this Empire. Today the exact nature of it is still debated, but the magical destruction and the instabilities in the magical foundations of the region give strong suspects of some arcane mishap, originated in The Spire.
Since that day, the region today known as Cursed Kingdom, is an abandoned place, where living beasts are mutated by the influence of wild magic, the very rules of the world are thrown away by Wild Magic Fields and their Anomalies.
Crazy or courageos adventurers try to retrieve Residuum from those areas, while other groups war over the destiny of this mysterious and deadly place.
The White Hell is the most dangerous of these Wild Magic Field, where your very soul is in danger of forever wandering those cold wastes.
Travelling the White Hell §
Travelling in this Wild Magic Field is considered to be the most dangerous journey that one can make. Maybe only barring The Spire, from which no one returns whole. Only expert Seekers adventure in the White Hell, with detailed equipment and an iron will.
After the Curse, the entire capital city became a land of eternal snow and winter, where countless perished and their souls still linger there, forever in search of other souls to take from imprudent travelers. Due to these tormented souls, surviving this city requires a good supply of Light Crystals, from which their energy keeps the souls away for their limited duration. Running out of crystals means a slow but sure death from the immaterials ghosts, who grasp at the living soul and suck their energy away,
It’s impossible to fight them, be it with steel or magic.
In case the Player Character find itself without the protection of a Light Crystal, each hour its life energy should decrease gradually. This can be simulated with you chosen RPG system by lowering the maximum life resource pool of the character, or can be covered by Fate Questions too. Some kind of resistance check could be implemented also if wanted. A Character should survive a maximum of a day without a Crystal, requiring at least a full night rest for its own soul to recuperate from the encounter with these tormented souls.
The city itself is always covered in snow, with freezing temperatures and dead bodies of unfortunate travellers often lingering the main routes of exploration.
Some Mutated Wildlife and Mutated Inhabitants live here as well, with a weird ecosystem only disturbed by intruders in search of the rare type of Residuum found here.
Event Crafter Lists §
Situation: Journeying the White Hell §
All locations are generally not inhabited permanently.















































































































































LocationsEncountersObjectsPP000TypeRandomizedRandomizedRandomized1Noble districtSeekersAnomalies2Artisanal districtBanditsEdibles3Market districtWildlifeField Feature4Industrial districtCult of the CurseLight Crystal5SlumsMutated WildlifeDead bodies6Frozen DocksMutated InhabitantsResiduum7The UniversityWardens of the Kingdom8Roll Twice, or None91011121314151617181920
Locations §
All locations refer to neighborhoods of the White Hell. Each of them could require it’s own Event Crafter table to fully explore. You should roll on this list when you feel the need of a change of district. Any Progression Point of this list should be applied as starting point of any more detailed exploration Event Crafter list of the single district, to keep the highened stakes.
Objects §
Field Feature §
When this is rolled, a peculiar characteristic of the Field will be found. It should be themed after the field the Player Character is exploring. In the case of he White Hell, for example, it could be ghost visions at the edge of the Crystal protective field, the freezing temperatures giving a challenge of some type or something along those lines. An cold-themed Anomaly could also be employed.
Residuum §
A Residuum object is found.

Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/Wilderness-Regi.title: Wilderness Region
Cursed-Kingdom/Locations/Wilderness-Regi.content:
The Cursed Wilderness §
The areas of the Cursed Kingdom that do not belong to any particula locations, are generally considered wilderness by locals, even if inside of it can be found numerous abandoned structures, villages and more, slowly being reclaimed by the twisted nature that grows here.
Travelling the Wilderness §
When travelling across the general wilderness of the Cursed Kingdom area, you can use either the Randomized Location Crafter system or the Event Crafter.

In the first case, Complete results before reaching or finding what you are looking for are treated as having found or reached your objective. The Region is left also if the Player Character leaves the Cursed Kingdom boundaries or enters another Region inside it (like a ruin or other point of interest). The following lists are made for use with Event Crafter, but are easily used with RLC too, using them as Known lists.
In the second case, all the following lists are Concluding or Concluding, Short lists, depending on preference and how long you want the exploration to be. If Conclusion is rolled and you haven’t reached or found what you are looking for, they will be present in this last location.

Event Crafter List §
Situation: Journeying the Wilderness §
All locations are generally not inhabited permanently.
TODO split locations in more granular entries, especially for Ruin and Natural POI.















































































































































LocationsEncountersObjectsPP000TypeRandomizedRandomizedRandomized1VillageSeekersWild Magic Field2AvampostBanditsEdibles3RuinWildlife4Natural Point of InterestCult of the Curse5Ruined Magical LaboratoryMutated Wildlife6Mutated Inhabitants7Wardens of the Kingdom8Archeologists9Roll Twice, or None1011121314151617181920
Locations §
Village §
Before the Curse, there were villages that dotted the countryside, now they are usually ghost villages, submerged in a eery silence broken by the passage of someone or something. Many now are used for shelter or as staging ground by groups before continuing to other places.
This location can usually be assumed to be a very small group of reuined buildings. For larger towns, a separate Event Crafter list with Location, Encounters and Objects can be constructed if desired.
Avampost §
These are locations built after the Curse, usually a good spot to encounter other factions resting and plotting the next moves. Generally nothing more than hastily built wooden structures, sometimes adapted from preexisting ruins.
Roll on the Description Meaning Table to have inspiration on them.
Ruin §
These locations were ancient even before the Curse struck.
These can be above ground bigger structures, like Castles, Temples, Shrines.
Alternatively, they can be underground structures, like Dungeons, Tombs, etc.
You can use Description Meaning Table for inspiration and can be explored using a separate Event Crafter or using RLC with the Dungeon Crawling additions from MM.
Natural Point of Interest §
These can be Caverns, rivers, heavily forested forest patches.
Ruined Magical Laboratory §
See Ruined Magical Laboratory.

Cursed-Kingdom/Starting-Seeds.content:

Explore the nearby Field for a Residuum object- Reach the nearby Field and explore it. - Bring back Residuum to sell.8-13A patron sent you to the Kingdom to find a legendary Residuum object that should heal any illness.You arrive at the Village with more questions than answers. You need information.- Find a lead for the curative Residuum object.14-20A sudden increase in Bandit activity near Seeker avamposts is worrying the community.You try to ambush a small group of Bandits on the road, they might know something.- Discover the origin of the Bandit’s increased activity.21-27An Archeologist is searching for Seekers to be of escort in an expedition towards a newly formed Wild Magic Field.You meet with the Archeologist to have more informations and discuss your reward.- Escort the Archeologist. - Keep them alive.28-33You are a Seeker hired by some Archeologists/Wardens to help them in capturing an important avampost from Bandits.You just arrived near the avampost, all is ready for the attack.- Help the Archeologists/Wardens take control of the avampost.34-40You just arrived in the Kingdom, but risking your life for Residuum is for losers. I’ll steal it from them instead.You just saw your first prey coming out from a Wild Magic Field, his backpack seems heavy.- Bring back some Residuum to Bandit’s Fortress.41-47It is time. In the morning we go from the The Haven to White Hell to find access to The Spire. Now is the time for searching some good stuff in White Hell.You just departed The Haven to reach White Hell, it will take some time.- Find Residuum in White Hell.54-60An Archeologist/Warden just hired you to help them in an attack against Wardens/Archelogists.You are in the wilderness with them, almost arrived at the place of the attack.- Help the faction achieve their objective.61-67A civil war has started in one kingdom of the Outside World over succession rights. One of the claimers sent you to reach White Hell and find the King’s Crown in the old palace to strengthen their claim.Begin at The Haven and prepare yourself for the travel there and its haunted grounds.- Find the King’s Crown. - Bring it back to your patron.68-73In The Haven, an Archeologist has been accused of murdering a high ranking Warden. He claims to be innocent and to be a plan of the Bandits.You just reached The Haven, ready to talk with the prime suspect.- Find the truth behind the murder.74-80An Archeologist claims to have developed a way to embed Residuum powers in weapons. She wants you to find a component inside a Ruined Magical Laboratory.You meet with the Archeologist, which explains the details of her new invention.- Test the invention in a relevant environment.81-87A person care to you has been seen recently as a Cultist of the Curse. You want to snap them out of it and bring them home safely.Begin talking with the last people that saw them, to find where they went.- Find the person. - Bring them home.88-93A very dangerous mutant animal has killed many adventurers. You want to hunt it to keep the Village safe.Begin in the Village, searching for informations on the beast.- Track down the Beast. - End the threat.94-100A rare specie of intelligent mutant is mind controlling Seekers and turning them against the others. Find information about the Controller.- Find the Controller. - Stop the menace.

Cursed-Kingdom/Summary.title: Summary
Cursed-Kingdom/Summary.content:
The Cursed Kingdom has been destroyed by a magic ritual 30 years ago, that transformed everything in a 100 kilometer radius from the The Spire.
The area is populated by monsters changed by magic, wild life, brave or foolish Seekers searching for Residuum objects. Standard magic is almost useless due to the risk of activating wild magic effects, so Residuum objects that protect against this are really wanted.
