 A small groups of kobolds is seen gathering food in the wilderness. If they follow, they lead them to a bandit group (Shadowcloaks from Ludvic background) near a swampy area where a kobold clan is kept as slaves by them. Use the avampost map
 A kobold totem made from animal skulls is found in a small grotto when searching for a place to encamp. Alexander can feel a divine power coming from it. Religion DC 13 to know Kurtulmak: God of Kobolds. A note written in good Common (by human bandit), talks about relocating the clan to the base in the swamp.

D&D-Campaign/Houserules.title: Houserules
D&D-Campaign/Houserules.content:
General §

Second dice from crit is maximized.
Potions takes normally a bonus action
Health potion is always maxed after using an action instead
The shape templates are done like what foundry proposes
Sight obstructions give half cover (+2 AC)

Groups §
Attack: Defender AC - Monster attack mod. Consult Result table.
Saving Throw: Saving Throw DC - Monster ST modifier. Consult Result table.
HP: Add all together, when enough damage is done to kill one, kill one.

Morale §

Underclock §
Reason:
Builds up suspense in dungeons before triggering a random encounter instead of only giving surprise.
It starts at 20 when you walk into a dungeon.  When it reaches 0, an Encounter happens.
You will periodically roll a six-sided Underworld die and subtract it from the Underclock whenever the party expends time or noise.  Examples of actions that provoke an Underclock Roll:

Exploring a new room (including long hallways).
Moving through 3 already-explored rooms.
Lingering or searches.
Making noise (e.g. kicking down a door).

NOTE: the noise of combat doesn’t normally contribute to the Underclock.
Some more facts about the Underclock:


The Underworld Die explodes.  If you get the maximum value (e.g. a 6 on a d6), immediately roll it again and subtract the result from the Underclock.


If the Underclock drops below 0, an Encounter is triggered.  After the Encounter resolves, the Underclock resets to 20.


If the Underworld Clock equals 0 exactly, it resets to 3.  The Underworld’s attention is elsewhere, momentarily.


If the Underworld Clock equals 3 exactly, a Shadowing Event occurs.  So the clock reaches 0, it bounces up to 3 and a Shadowing Event occurs.  (These are just omens/spoor/clues, more or less.)


Rests in dungeons §
You can rest at any time.  You’ll get all of your HP back after you do.  There are 3 prices.

The first cost is time.  You’ll have to roll some Underclock Rolls.


If you are resting in the middle of a well-traveled location, make 3 rolls.


If you are in a secret room that no one else knows about, you don’t need to make any rolls.


Everything in between is either 1 or 2 rolls (defaulting to 2 rolls if you aren’t sure).
These rolls explode normally.  If you are interrupted by an encounter, you’ll need to start over.



The second cost is a ration.  Cross it off your inventory.
The third cost is attention.   Each time you rest in the dungeon, increase the size of your Underclock Die.  d6 → d8 → d10 → d12 → d20.  Each time you spend a night sleeping on the surface, decrease the Underworld die by one size, down to a minimum of d6.

Everyone knows that you shouldn’t eat anything in the Underworld.

Interesting articles §
How to handle informations and investigations §
https://diyanddragons.blogspot.com/2019/10/landmark-hidden-secret.html
Three meta-types of information are offered. The first, landmark, is automatic and free, given immediately by the GM. The second, hidden, is earned by asking for it and payed for in some way (time, risk, etc). The third, secret, is only given when players succeed with chance—usually a dice roll.
My opinion:
divinding info as landmarks (free and evident) and hidden should be enough.
Hidden require the risk of uncovering it and might require time cost. Can be a treasure, can be a trap, can be info. Both positive and negative. Are always found once some action for it is taken.
A secret can be the result of a puzzle or other risky encounter, whose presence can be discovered as landmark or hidden. With secrets there is a chance of failing when trying.
Overview:

Landmark: things you find in the hex or in the room.
Hidden: Something is there that is covered, inside, behind etc. A chest, a curtain covering a wall. Will you spend time investigating (automatic success, cost is usually time) and the risk in uncovering what is there? (can be a trap or treasure…)
Secret: Locked behind a test. It’s Hidden + can fail and remain locked. Should have bigger rewards, sometimes even both positive/negative.
The presence of a secret can be a landmark or hidden. A library aligned in the wall, with rotation marks on the ground. How to find and understand the opening mechanism though?


Component-based monsters §
https://mindstorm.blot.im/nested-monster-hit-dice
Monsters with nested components that give abilities and can be individually targeted. OSR focus, but should work in 5e.
It can work with landmark/hidden components above. Landmark are explained on first encounter.
Overview:

Build complex monsters by splitting their HD and nesting it as components. The more complex your nesting the harder the monster is to defeat. Going five layers deep implies a powerful “boss” monster that will prove a challenge.
Reveal all components except hidden ones when describing the monster. Make sure the players understand the components. You may need to repeat this throughout the fight as a summary of the situation.
When players attack, always ask them how and what they attack. This is why it’s important that you’ve revealed the components. They need to choose a method and a target of attacking.
If the monster can be defeated without all components being destroyed, tie certain ones to a “Lifeblood” tag. Destroying all Lifeblood components kills the monster.
Tie abilities and attacks to the components. All attacks and abilities should be tied up to hit dice in some way. Everything than becomes negatable by PC actions and you’ll have a better grasp when making a ruling about ad-hoc actions.
Players automatically fail when they attack a component without dealing with the upper layer. When this happens, spell out very clearly why their attack failed. This may involve revealing hidden components.
Critical hits either deal double damage or the player can opt to redirect to any known component. This bypasses the rule about upper level components acting as a shield. If the component is protected by a hidden layer that the players haven’t discovered, inform them about the hidden component and then tell them they must choose a different target.



The Antenna blocks access to child nodes. Need to make noise/cut them or some other solution to block them.
The carapace is uncovered after the first attack on the main body, even if the heart is visible under it’s semi transparent layer.



Stealth Turn (or Better Stealth gameplay) §
https://www.mindstormpress.com/stealth-turns
Overview §

Interesting even if it assumes Turn based exploration, like ICRPG.
Without turns, the table can be useful, together with rule of Rolling Stealth only if actually needed.

Gameflow: Without turns, after everyone has said what they do, you roll on the Stealth Event Die to check any events.

The stealth Event Die can be rolled in case of prepping or improvising game:

In depth on each entry:

Bonus inspiration tables §

D&D-Campaign/Lazy-DM.title: Lazy DM
D&D-Campaign/Lazy-DM.content:
In a given encounter, choose the monsters that make sense in the current story, location, and situation.
Determine if the encounter may be deadly. An encounter may be deadly if the sum total of monster challenge ratings is greater than one quarter of the sum total of character levels, or half the sum total of character levels if the characters are above 4th level.


Current party: 3 Lvl 8 = 24 / 2 = 12
Current party: 5 Lvl 8 = 40 / 2 = 20
Current party: 4 Lvl 8 = 32 / 2 = 16
Current party: 4 Lvl 7 = 28 / 2 = 14
Current party: 4 Lvl 6 = 24 / 2 = 12
Current party: 3 Lvl 6 = 18 / 2 = 9
Current party: 3 Lvl 5 = 15 / 2 = 7.5
Current party: 4 Lvl 5 = 20 / 2 = 10
Current party: 4 Lvl 4 = 16 / 4 = 4
Current party: 3 Lvl 3 = 9 / 4 = 2.25
From <https://slyflourish.com/the_lazy_encounter_benchmark.html>
Lazy DM Steps §

Review the characters
Create a strong start
Outline potential scenes
Define secrets and clues
Develop fantastic locations
Outline important NPCs
Choose relevant monsters
Select magic item rewards

D&D-Campaign/PCs/Dreandian.title: Dreandian
D&D-Campaign/PCs/Dreandian.content:
Story Arc §
Overview §
The 2 NPCs could return in the future as ghosts having some unfinished business. They manage to contact him due to some external event or magic. They could be in another plane as slaves/prisoners. Maybe the Abyss? Fey?
Part 1 §
During an unrelated adventures, maybe Axelholm, they will find a mirror/well/small pond where Dreandian will see the reflection of both friends in its place. They will point to the Githyanki or Githzerai in the Astral Plane. They will need to find a way to travel there and meet them.
This adventure will entice surviving in the plane while travelling there, so small exploration encounters and some combat.
Part 2 §
Once there, they will be asked to help in a raid to the Mind Flayers, where Draendian will recognize the chief as the old chief that led the attack. Adventure will be a map of attack to the group, where there will be traps too.
Background §
Dreandian was an orphan and he was always bullied for being a half-elf - the only half-elf in fact in the small town. He lost part of his ear at a young age, while defending his best friend from bandits, which was a halfing named Zalner. Thankfully that was all he lost, for the time being.
He always had a passion for music which he picked up from the village’s archpriestess, Mentee; the closest thing he and Zalner had for a mother.
Unfortunately, at the time war was raging in that region of the world. And while Dreandian and Zalner were exploring one day in the nearby forest, a skirmishing army raided the town leaving none alive.
He and Zalner, not having anywhere to go and wanting to avenge the destruction of the temple, decided to enlist to fight back.
After a year in training they finally got their chance to avenge Mentee’s death, but at a terrible cost. Zalner did not make it and died on the battlefield in Dreandian’s arms. Dreandian considered himself responsible and never forgave himself for it.
After that fateful battle the war ended and not having a home or a friend, Dreandian wandered the world. Finding solice in his music he kept the memory of Zalner and Mentee alive. Tapping into his pain he was able to unlock certain abilities that allowed him to weave magic. As he realised what he was able to do he tried exploring his abilities and educating himself wherever he could, be it temples or libraries and however he could, be it legally or illegally. Leading the life of a rogue, he avoided staying in one place for too long, considering he’d try to scam rich folk for extra coin. But when the need arised, he would also defend any innocents in need, always keeping in mind the closest thing he ever had to a family.
Dreandian has a soft spot for non-humans, especially youngling orphans. On the other hand, he always keeps a distance from humans, due to his past. He always has an amiable look, decorated with a witty smile. But he’s too eager to pick a fight, always finding an excuse to taunt or provoke anybody that “has it coming”. Choosing to have his hair short and facial hair unshaved, he enjoys displaying his half-elf origin as a way of rebellion against non approving humans.
Survey §
What are some NPCs important to your character? (both friendly and unfriendly, not necessary for your PC to be aware of them) *

Zalner (his halfling best friend that died during a battle he and Dreandian fought together).
Mentee (the archpriestess of the small town that was the closest thing to a mother to Dreandian and Zalner).

What are some FACTIONS important to your character? (both friendly and unfriendly, not necessary for your PC to be aware of them) *
I’m not sure which faction, but for the backstory I created my PC fought against an army that destroyed his home.
What would you as a player appreciate your character do during the course of the campaign? (example: I’d like for my PC to resolve this backstory problem, I’d like for my PC to fight demons/celestials/other big faction, I’d like for my PC to have a Palace/Stronghold/Other location and it become the central hub for the party) *
I’d like for my PC to finally find peace and find the strength to move on from his friend’s death.
From <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1QJfLZI9AQfozYNNBHPLAAkjzgP8IXYB3pYbhvqia_K0/edit#response=ACYDBNi2ch4FxzubmiQFYd1cZsyobTiayDX_5XudKHPUpHPySaN3BIexk81MCNykhRuekEs>

D&D-Campaign/PCs/Jaylon.title: Jaylon
D&D-Campaign/PCs/Jaylon.content:
Story Arc §
Overview §
Master Durin? Could return in some wilderness related thing?
Part 1 §
Part 2 §
Background §
My name is Jaylon, I have been adventuring for many years, exploring the wilderness and aiding those in need. I have seen many strange and wondrous places, and have even ventured deep into the forgotten reaches of the world.
But my last journey brought me to the ruins of an old dwarven forge, and I have been captured by the guards who patrol the area. Despite your pleas for mercy, you were thrown into a prison deep within the forge and have been there for some time now. I have been in captivity for many months, enduring grueling labor and wretched conditions. Despite this, I have managed to keep their spirit and courage to stay alive.
I learned to shoot from an old hunter I met in the woods. His name was Master Durin, and he was a master of the bow and arrow. He taught me about the importance of proper form, precision, and accuracy when shooting a bow. He also taught me about tracking and hunting prey, as well as the art of camouflage and stealth.
And no, I haven’t lived my whole life as a hunter or wilderness person. I grew up in a small village, where I learned the basics of survival and tracking. However, I always felt a strong connection to nature and yearned to explore the wilds. When I was old enough, I left my village and ventured out into the world, learning more and more about the wilderness as I went. Over time, I became an expert at hunting, tracking, and navigating the wilds, and my skills have served me well during my many adventures.
I’m not a fan of cities. I find the hustle and bustle of city life to be overwhelming, and I don’t enjoy the crowds or the noise. I prefer the peace and quiet of the wilderness, and I’m much more comfortable in the wide open spaces of nature.
From <https://discordapp.com/channels/@me/1080155068558491788>

D&D-Campaign/PCs/Ludvic.title: Ludvic
D&D-Campaign/PCs/Ludvic.content:
Story Arc §
Overview §
The Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction are now headed by Klara (ex wife), after remarrying to Gerard out of need and killing him to take her life in her own hands. Now she keeps the Guild running with subterfuge, sabotaging and stealing. No harm is ever dealt to women and children though. This is something Ludvic would do in her mind, after being abandoned.
Part 1 DONE §
She just discovered from her spies (the tavern owner) in the region where Ludvic is. She sends a group of drows to kill him. Ambush is in Conyberry. If they skip it, the Ambush will be in a different spot when returning from ButterSkull Ranch. Info can be found on drows: symbol of the Shadowcloaks. No reference to wife, only orders to kill Ludvic and any witnesses.
Result: He knows, Ludvic wants to send a letter to ask to stop to hunt him. Wife will plan a trap to let it go somewhere not safe or encounter. Maybe the daughter can do something to trap him with a fake letter of help or something.
Part 2 §
In the lockbox found by Ludvic there are some letters coming from a person named K.
In those, they talk about how Halia Thornton needs to investigate the magical waves and find a way to fix them. Attribute the fixing of it to the Shadowcloaks somehow. If she needs to use adventurers for this, afterwards she needs to “clean up”. In Neverwinter they need that the group will be seen as benevolent to the population, since they have a “new leadership” that the Zhentarim find interesting.
Part 3 §
Ludvic goes to his old place in Neverwinter and finds Gerard still there, very old and not really working, but more passing the time there and feeling involved.
Katrina is there,
Background §
Ex accountant turned wizard.
Important NPCs (bold is mine)
 

Klara, his “ex”-wife, he didn’t really divorce her. He just left, on day. (Head of Shadowcloaks, in Neverwinter)
Katerina, his daughter, she is a weaver, he doesn’t not much about her, she doesn’t talk to him for more than 20 years. (Lieutenant. She is managing the fake businesses in Neverwinter, will try to attract Ludvic for help as a fake 3rd party)
Wilbur, his son, he is a scavenger, he throws him out of the house at 16, he was stealing money from him. No news ever since. (Worked for the Guild. Now he is a lieutenant)
Gerard, his old boss. Gerard was an wealthy and abusive owner from an accounting firm. (Still there, married to Klara)

Important Factions
Shadowcloaks, criminal organization, Ludwig was unknowingly doing the accounting for them. His sudden disappearance may have raised suspicion.
Objective:
He would like to achieve something important, that people will remember. He would that is name to be remember.
From <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1QJfLZI9AQfozYNNBHPLAAkjzgP8IXYB3pYbhvqia_K0/edit#response=ACYDBNhlh_UOeL4Hy9FewVnEXie_bLKh7G_seVRonJi7nkPUZCM5MnqnaSiTehGDbk7B2II>

D&D-Campaign/PCs/Madrick-Rootmuncher,-Go.title: Madrick Rootmuncher, Goliath Barbarian
D&D-Campaign/PCs/Madrick-Rootmuncher,-Go.content:
In game story arc §
Overview §
The Inulanat Clan has been captured by a demon cult (humanoids with some minor demons ) and forced to slavery. They are in the area. They are used for their strength for raw labor in mining some ancient device in a lost dungeon.
They are kept as slaves thanks to magical collars, that incapacitates them on command.
Part 1 DONE §
They will encounter a human travelling merchant called Isen with 2 Goliath bodyguards (Keorok, slimmer and faster, with and bow and Zauman, similar to Madrick, using an Great Axe).
The Goliath have wound marks on the neck, Perception DC 12 to see.
They are escaped slaves and know Madrick. They will tell about Anela being a druid in a far away forest since a few months, since they escaped while still travelling to an unknown location and encountered her a few weeks ago. They don’t know where she is, being a druid, it’s difficult to pinpoint her. They  can call upon The Nameless to ask this, he will gadly help.
Part 2: The Cult of Dispater collecting gold and ruby to summon §
Background: §
My name is Madrick, Goliath born of the Inulanat tribe to the far south. Mine was a small nomadic tribe, a poor one. We survived by dodging larger warbands, and by living on their scraps. Any animal herd we encountered had already been thinned out by others, and rarely were we first to forage an area for fruits and grains. What little we did find was shared between all in the tribe, first by need, then the surplus by merit. 
I rarely got any surplus. As a young adult I was a bad forager, a bad hunter, a bad tracker, and a middling warrior at best. The few useful skills I did have like my strength and my skill with a mace might have been of use in a larger tribe that could fairly compete for resources with the others, but we were too few to even envisage that. 
The result was simple. I was a burden on the tribe. I had to rip roots out of the ground to gnaw on them all day and get a few extra calories. I earned my middle name because of this practice. I was soon known as “Rootmuncher”. 
A few days after my twentieth birthday, the decision was communaly taken to exile me from the Inulanat tribe. There was no anger in that decision, no animosity. Only deep melancholy, as I had to leave my friends and my family, expected to die in the cold.
My father, Miran “Treebreaker” was the leader of the tribe, so he himself burned the emblem of the tribe off of my tunic, leaving the hole that is still there to this day. He had watery eyes and a grim expression as he watched me walk away in the snow. 
I survived only through luck (finding a network of caves with mushrooms to eat in my second week of exile) and sheer determination. I knew I could come back to my tribe one day with honour if I expanded my skills and became a true survivalist, and so I would not let myself die without a fight. 
I also knew of other Goliaths from a few friendly tribes that got exiled in earlier years and might still be alive. I want to live to find them, to bond and compete with them. A good childhood friend, Anela “Thintree” Kulaga is one of those exiles. She was a sickly and weak member of another small tribe that was slowly developing druidic powers in her teenage years before being exiled. I want to figure out if she survived, and if she improved her knowledge of nature. 
Once out of the mountains I travelled north, doing my best to survive. It became easier once I came closer to civilization and started doing odd jobs for food and shelter. I helped farmers with their harvests, I ripped roots out of the ground so buildings could be erected, I was the bodyguard of a Gnome merchant for more than a month. His name was Sinlen Dublis, and he taught me how to stitch my shirt back together. He might also be a source to buy goggles of light from, since he sells various baubles. 
NPCs:  §
Miran “Treebreaker” Inulanat: Father. Strong Goliath Barbarian. Charismatic tribe leader. Survival of the fittest and survival of the tribe as a unit are the most important things in his leadership style. We share a loving bond, but he valued the survival of the tribe over my own. I want to prove myself to him. 
Anela “Thintree” Kulaga: Good childhood friend. A Goliath Druid. Sickly and weak of body, but smart and filled with love for nature. Felt suffocated by the competitiveness of Goliath society, as she does not care for comparing herself with others. 
Sinlen Dublis: Male gnome traveling merchant. Taught me the basics of living in civilization. Outwardly friendly to strangers, for good client relations, but reserved and shy when not working. 
Flaws:  §
I care little for possessions that do not have an obvious and near immediate use. I will throw a pouch of gold away before a solid rope. Does not apply to objects of sentimental value. 
My competitive side is mostly turned inwardly. I will seek increasing challenges, and will be unhappy if not improving. Am more likely to put myself in danger because of this. 
Description: 7 and ½ feet tall. Bald. Light grey skin with symmetrical black markings. 
Light brown tunic, with a large burn mark over the heart. Pants of a darker brown 
My Objective:
I would like the possibility of interacting with a few Goliaths once in a while, just as NPCs. My character is pretty conflicted when thinking of his place in Goliath society, and talking with others would be interesting for development.
I will want to earn a new nickname for my character after a while, since he earned his current name through shame. But that should come pretty naturally as the party gains accomplishements.

D&D-Campaign/Resources/Obsidian/Image-Ad.title: Image Adjustment
D&D-Campaign/Resources/Obsidian/Image-Ad.content:
Image Positions §
Obsidian internal images ![[]] will change immediately, but for external images ![]()Obsidian needs to be refreshed: ctrl + r to see the changes.
Clear §













ExampleDescription![[image.png|clear]]clear will allow that image to sit below another imageIf it’s on the same side instead of sitting in the middle of the page.
Cover (Mostly for Customizable Version) §













ExampleDescription![[image.png|cover]]cover will resize the image maintaining aspect ratio and avoid stretching.
Sizing (Mostly for Customizable Version) §













ExampleDescription![[image.png|loc|sban|200]]Place the |<numbers> sizing at the end of the image line and it will shrink the image to that size.
Simplified Version §
Left/Right/Center §





















ExampleDescription![[image.png|left]]left will move the image to the left.![[image.png|right]right will move the image to the right.![[image.png|c]c will move the image to the center.
Banner §





















ExampleDescription![[image.png|banner]]banner will crop the image height-wise to about 150px while setting the width to cover the entire page.![[image.png|banner+small]]banner+small will crop the image height-wise to about 100px while setting the width to cover the entire page.![[image.png|banner+tall]]banner+tall will crop the image height-wise to about 500px while setting the width to cover the entire page.
Portrait §





















ExampleDescription![[image.png|portrait]]portrait will crop the image width-wise to about 40% while setting the height to a standard of about 400px.![[image.png|portrait+small]]portrait+small will crop the image width-wise to about 20% while setting the height to a standard of about 200px.![[image.png|portrait+tall]]portrait+tall will crop the image width-wise to about 50% while setting the height to a standard of about 500px.
Profile §

⚠ Not fully working unless you use the pc property.


















ExampleDescription![[image.png|profile]]profile will round the borders of the image to create a round image and size it to about 100px.![[image.png|profile+medium]]profile+medium will round the borders of the image to create a round image and resize it to about 250px.
Customizable Version §
Left/Right §

















ExampleDescription![[image.png|locl]]locl will move the image to the left.![[image.png|locr]]locr will move the image to the right.
Inner Image Position §





























ExampleDescription![[image.png|pl]]pl will move the inside of the image to the left.![[image.png|pr]]pr will move the inside of the image to the right.![[image.png|pt]]pt will move the inside of the image to the top.![[image.png|pb]]pb will move the inside of the image to the bottom.![[image.png|pc]]pc will move the inside of the image to the center.
Inner Image Position Adjustments §
These will inch the images around if the ^ above code isn’t enough.

























































ExampleDescription![[image.png|p+cr]]p+cr will move the inside of the image to the center right.![[image.png|p+cl]]p+cl will move the inside of the image to the center left.![[image.png|p+ct]]p+ct will move the inside of the image to the center top of the image.![[image.png|p+cct]]p+cct will move the inside of the image to the center top, slightly higher than p+ct![[image.png|p+tc]]p+tc will move the inside of the image to the center top, slightly lower than pt![[image.png|p+tcc]]p+tcc will move the inside of the image to the center top, slightly lower than p+tc![[image.png|p+cb]]p+cb will move the inside of the image to the center bottom of the image.![[image.png|p+ccb]]p+ccb will move the inside of the image to the center bottom, slightly lower than p+cb![[image.png|p+bc]]p+bc will move the inside of the image to the center bottom, slightly higher than pb![[image.png|p+bcc]]p+bcc will move the inside of the image to the center bottom, slightly higher than p+bc

D&D-Campaign/Resources/Obsidian/Leaflet.title: Leaflet
D&D-Campaign/Resources/Obsidian/Leaflet.content:
Obsidian Leaflet §
Adds interactable mapping functionality to Obsidian.md, using Leaflet.js


Proof of concept currently. May not work as expected. Currently only tested on Windows & Mac.
Working with the plugin & example §
A map can be created with a leaflet code block. For example:
```leaflet
image: https://i.imgur.com/jH8j3mJ.jpg
height: 500px
lat: 50
long: 50
height: 500px
minZoom: 1
maxZoom: 10
defaultZoom: 5
unit: meters
scale: 1
marker: <type>,<latitude>,<longitude>,<link>
```
Options §





















































































OptionDescriptionDefaultidUnique identifier (can be anything). Required.imageDirect URL/file path to an image file to be used as the map layer.OpenStreetMap maplatDefault latitude to display when rendering.50% (image) / 39.983334 (open street map)longDefault longitude to display when rendering.50% (image) / -82.983330 (open street map)heightHeight of the map element. Can be provided in pixels or percentage of window height.500pxminZoomMinimum allowable zoom level of the map.1maxZoomMaximum allowable zoom level of the map.10defaultZoomMap will load zoomed to this level.5zoomDeltaZoom level will change by this amount when zooming.1unitUnit to display distances inmetersscaleScale factor for image map distance calculation.1markerCreate immutable markers on the mapmarkerFileCreate immutable marker from a note’s frontmattermarkerFolderCreate immutable markers from all of the notes in a given folder
Map IDs §
As of 3.0.0, map ids are required. If a note with a old map block is opened, the plugin will warn you that the map now requires an ID.
Once an old map is given an ID, the plugin will try to associate the marker data with the new map.
The first time you open the plugin after updating to 3.0.0, a backup of your marker data will be created in case you need to downgrade. If you run into issues, please create an issue on Github.
Image Maps §
Image Map URL / file path §
Image maps can be loaded one of three ways:

Direct URL (e.g., https://i.imgur.com/jH8j3mJ.jpg)
Obsidian URL (e.g., obsidian://open?vault=VaultName&file=Path/To/Image.jpg)
Direct path to image (e.g., Path/To/Image.jpg)

Multi-Image Maps §
Images can be layered on top of each other by providing multiple images to the plugin:
```leaflet
id: Map With Layered Images
image: Image1.jpg
image: Image2.jpg
image: Image3.jpg
```
This will generate a map with 3 layers. Image 1 will be on top, Image 2 in the middle, and Image 3 on bottom. The images will be aligned around their center points.
The control box in the top right of the map will allow you to change layers.
Markers can be created and saved on each layer separately from one another.
If multiple images are provided, an ID must be given to the map, or the map will only display the first provided image.
Latitude and Longtitude of Image Maps §
Because an image map does not have a true coordinate system, the latitude and longitude provided must be given as a percentage from the top left corner of the image.
This setting may seem to not do anything without changing the default zoom level of the map.
Unit and Scale §
If provided, the plugin will scale the calculated distance between two points by scale and display the result as xxx unit.
Markers §
New markers can be added to the map by right clicking.
If any additional marker types have been created in the settings, a list will appear to choose from.
Once a marker has been created, it can be dragged to a different location.
Markers created on the map will be saved to the map instance. Marker data saved this way will persist as long as the map is associated with a note - if the map blocks are removed from notes, or if all of the notes containing map blocks are removed, the data associated with it will be deleted after 7 days.
Marker Coordinates §
Alt-clicking on a marker will reveal its coordinates.
Marker Links §
A marker can also point to a note; right-click on it, and a popup will appear. The target can be entered as the name of the note. Additionally, headers or blocks within a note can be the target of a marker:
Note
Note#Header1
If you have multiple notes with the same name, you should specify the direct path to the note. Otherwise, the map may not open the one you expect.
Once linked, a click will open the note (Ctrl/Cmd-click to open in new window).
Additionally, markers can be created by dragging a note from the file tree and dropping it on the map.
Marker links can also be set to external websites. Clicking the marker will open the website.
Obsidian Commands as Links §
Markers links can also be set to a defined Obsidian command from the command palette. This must be the full name of the command as it appears in the palette.
Setting a marker link to a command will execute the command when the marker is clicked.
Markers Defined in the Code Block §
Markers may be defined directly in the code block using the following syntax:
marker: <type>,<latitude>,<longitude>,<link>
An arbitrary number of markers can be defined, but none of these markers will be editable. If a change needs to be made to these markers, the code block must be edited.
The marker link may be defined as an Obsidian wikilink.
These markers will not be included in exported marker data.
Marker Files, Marker Folders and Marker Tags §
These parameters allow you to create markers directly from a list of markdown note files.
A note specified in this manner should have the following frontmatter tags:
location: [lat, long] REQUIRED
mapmarker: <marker-type> OPTIONAL
There is no limit to how many of these parameters you can have defined in the code block; all of the files found will be parsed for defined markers.
Please note that until I can utilize some form of caching, having a large amount of marker files defined could impact performance.
Marker File §
Marker files may be defined in the code block using the following syntax:
markerFile: [[WikiLinkToFile]] OR
markerFile: Direct/Path/To/Note
Marker Folders §
Marker folders may be defined in the code block using the following syntax:
markerFolder: Direct/Path/To/Folder
This will search through all of the notes in the specified folder, even in sub folders.
Marker Tags §
If you have the Dataview plugin installed, markers may also be created from tags using the following syntax:
markerTag: #<tag>, #<tag>, ...
Each markerTag parameter will return notes that have all of the tags defined in that paramter. If you are looking for files containing any tag listed, use separate markerTag parameters.
If one or more markerFolder parameters are specified, the markerTag parameter will only look for notes in the folders that contain the tags.
Examples §
markerFile: [[MarkerFile]]

would

Load the MarkerFile.md note file and, if it has the correct frontmatter fields, create a marker for it.

markerFile: [[MarkerFile]]
markerFolder: People and Locations

would

Load the MarkerFile.md note
Look through the People and Locations folder for additional notes

markerTag: "#"location, "#"friends

would

Find all notes tagged with both #location and #friends and create markers using their frontmatter

markerFolder: People and Locations
markerFolder: Interests/Maps of the World
markerTags: "#"people, "#"friends
markerTags: "#"Paris

would search for notes that

Are in the folders People and Locations OR Interests/Maps of the World, AND
Contain both tags # people AND # friends OR the tag # Paris

Marker CSV File §
Marker data may be exportable to a CSV file. This data takes the following format:























Column 1Column 2Column 3Column 4Column 5Column 6Column 7Map IDMarker TypeLatitudeLongitudeMarker LinkMarker LayerMarker ID
Map ID is the path to the note plus “real” for real maps OR the path to the image OR the map id defined in the code block. Example:
Path/To/Note.md/Path/To/File.jpg OR
Path/To/Note.md/real OR
Path/To/Note.md/map-id-defined-in-code-block
If left blank, Marker Type will default to “default”.
Marker layer may be kept blank if a map only has 1 layer.
For new markers, Marker ID may be kept blank.
Marker data in this format can then be re-imported. This feature is still under development and may not work as expected.
Distances §
Ctrl/Cmd-clicking the map, then Ctrl/Cmd-clicking again, will display the distance between the two points.
Real-world map distances are displayed in meters.
Image maps can have an optional unit and scaling factor provided to display.
Configuration §
Note Preview §
Use Obsidian’s note preview when hovering a linked marker.
Please note, the Obsidian Page preview core plugin must be enabled to use this feature.
Latitude and Longitude §
A real-world map will open to this default latitude and longitude if not provided.
Base Marker §
The base marker setting allows you to define a marker that other markers can be layered on top of. If no additional markers have been added, right clicking on the map will place this marker.
Additional Markers §
Additional marker types can be added, selectable from a context menu on the map.
Creating an additional marker §
Adding a new marker displays a new window, where the new marker parameters can be added.

























ParameterDescriptionMarker NameDisplayed in the context menu when adding a marker (e.g., Location, Event, Person)Marker IconName of the Font Awesome icon to useLayer IconLayer this icon on top of the base marker. If off, the icon itself will be used.Icon ColorOverride the default icon color
If layer icon is on, the icon be moved around the base icon by clicking and dragging, to customize where the icon is layered. If Shift is held while moving the icon, it will snap to the midlines.
Version History §
3.0.0 §
New Features §

Map IDs are now required.

A map that does not have an id will not render
The plugin will try to load previously defined marker data once an id has been given to the map.
This means marker definitions are no longer tied to maps - giving a map on a different note the same ID will load the same marker data


Marker data that is not associated with a file will now be deleted after 7 days to prevent data accumulation
Map data is now only saved if the map has defined markers
Image files can now be linked using an Obsidian wikilink (e.g., Image Name.jpg)
New markerFile and markerFolder parameters in maps

markerFile will read a note file’s frontmatter and create a marker based on the marker and location tags

marker should be a defined marker type (will default to default if not provided)
location should be a array of [latitude, longitude]. If not provided, the marker will not be created
The marker link target will be set to the file


markerFolder will read all of the files in the folder, and try to parse the frontmatter as above.


Made display of marker link in tooltip consistent with Obsidian’s display style
Added data attributes to marker HTML element

data-type: marker type
data-link: marker link target, if any
data-mutable: whether marker data can be edited
data-type: marker type name (such as default)


Switched from uuid to 6 digit nanoid
Rendering improvements

Bug Fixes §

Fixed issue where a new marker type’s Layer Icon setting was not respecting the default layer marker setting
Fixed issue where clicking a marker could open the context menu
Fixed issue where clicking a marker without a link could cause an error
Fixed issue with opening a marker link defined with alt-text
Fixed issue where resizing the leaf containing a map caused it to calculate marker positions incorrectly
Fixed issue where having the same map open in multiple windows was not adding markers correctly
Fixed issue where dragging a marker created on a map open in multiple views would not drag correctly on other maps
Fixed issue where turning the plugin off would leave map tiles in random locations on open notes
Fixed issue where showing the note preview of a note with a map that is already open in the workspace would cause the map to be disassociated

2.1.0 §

Added marker parameter in code block
Fixed issue where importing a CSV file that changed a marker on an open map failed to update the marker information

2.0.0 §

Added ability to export marker data to a CSV file
Added ability to import marker data from a CSV file
Added Obsidian-like file chooser to marker link path

1.3.0 §

Removed requirement for file path in marker target
Added ability to target blocks in marker target

1.2.0 §

Add rudimentary distance calculation between two points on the map
Fixed issue where opening the same map in multiple leaves could cause one map to de-render

1.1.0 §

Maps now recalculate their sizing when the window is resized

1.0.0 §

Switch to proper semantic versioning
Added Note Preview setting

This setting displays the Obsidian page preview when you hover over a linked marker


Map height can now be in provided as a percentage

0.3.1 §

Added image map layers

It is now possible to have an arbitrary number of image maps layered on top of each other by supplying multiple images to the code block
Markers created on a specific layer are only displayed when that layer is active
Navigation between layers is done using the layer control box in the top right



0.2.2 §

Added real-world maps
Added latitude and longitude options
Added zoom delta option
Added tooltip display on markers that link to notes
Bug fixes

Installation §
From within Obsidian §
From Obsidian v0.9.8, you can activate this plugin within Obsidian by doing the following:

Open Settings > Third-party plugin
Make sure Safe mode is off
Click Browse community plugins
Search for this plugin
Click Install
Once installed, close the community plugins window and activate the newly installed plugin

From GitHub §

Download the Latest Release from the Releases section of the GitHub Repository
Extract the plugin folder from the zip to your vault’s plugins folder: <vault>/.obsidian/plugins/
Note: On some machines the .obsidian folder may be hidden. On MacOS you should be able to press Command+Shift+Dot to show the folder in Finder.
Reload Obsidian
If prompted about Safe Mode, you can disable safe mode and enable the plugin.
Otherwise head to Settings, third-party plugins, make sure safe mode is off and
enable the plugin from there.

Updates §
You can follow the same procedure to update the plugin
Warning §
This plugin comes with no guarantee of stability and bugs may delete data.
Please ensure you have automated backups.
TTRPG plugins §
If you’re using Obsidian to run/plan a TTRPG, you may find my other plugin useful:

Dice Roller - Roll & re-roll dice in notes

Write descriptions of main scenes and personality of the spirit of the Lady. The body doesn’t talk, has a wide fixed smile joker-style.
Finish temple encounter on the top. Descriptions and define better the puzzle.
3 May §
Situation:
Dwarf translating book of portals, is going to only be able to translate how to turn it on/off, not changing the destination.
Nulbuzar has vaults that are keeping sealed the gates. Prepare dungeon for it.
They want to go to Ancient Battlefield. Add special abilities to enemies as on the file.
They need to distribute gold first, Harbin will have the list.
TODO
finish Dragon Barrow. Need to populate the map.
Start to prepare Vaults. Make first section of Tome first, then cyclic layout, then populate with the Tome again or WWN.
End result:
they did the Ancient Battlefield, put the book in the bag of holding and went away.
they want to do Dragon Barrow and then return to Phandalin.
19 Apr 23 §
They are in Phandalin.
Sinlen is the new manager at the Miner’s Exchange.
Madrick brought the clan to the Manor and they setup camp there for the time being.
Anela will go away the next day, towards the swamps
Xanlock will propose Dragon Barrow Adv and remind them of the Ancient Battlefield quest next to it. “There is a source of waves coming from there, maybe it can contain some answers.”
Sinlen has opened the lockbox, read again and define better if needed. Lockbox of Part 2
Draendian is going shopping at Lionshield Coster
TODO:
Ludvic wants to know about more factions that would be interested in the adventurer’s guild for work.
Define more NPCs for the druid circle of the Domains of Neverwinter.
Make a list of possible Patrons for the Adventurer’s Guild
5 Apr 23 §
They will sleep near the Shrine and also return to Phandalin.
They have around 10 goliaths with them, will leave in Phandalin.
They want to start an adventurer guild at the manor and convince the goliaths and mercenaries to remain in their service.
Travelling §
Random encounters during travel, check the hexcrawl ones as base, roll for disposition based on 2d6, for a Bell curve.
While in the forest, Anela will leave the group and they will encounter The Nameless, Warforged Druid which will simply thanks them and will provide them with a large seed, which needs to be planted in some terrain to ask for help.
Random encounters. Disposition 2d6.
Use Mythic tables to generate details.
- Orcs from the clan, the clan has collapsed and all are fragmented around. They could be bandits, hunters.
- undeads
- Travellers from Neverwinter
- Travellers from the other kingdoms
- Missionaries from one of the religions.
- Fleeing cultists
Evaluate based on waves too, randomly start them, 1 on 1d10 per day.
In Phandalin §

Give news of faction events coming from travellers

Order of the Gauntlet found and destroyed a cover group of man of laws who were working for the Zhentarim.
Zhentarim tried to establish a base of operation in Neverwinter commercial district, got ambushed by Shadowcloaks.



The Manor is still in the process of being refurbished, only 2-3 days passed. Some rooms are habitable now. The mercenaries are helping.
NPCs

Harbin Wester has been busy with the population rebuilding the town.
Xanlok the Tortle Wizard has been researching and found clues of an object pulsating with the wave energy in the Ancient Battlefield, which is probably the cause of the elemental undeads coming from there.

Also, he found the story of Dragon Barrow and how the weapon could be useful against the dragon. Go there to search for clues about its location.


Halia Thornton has been apprehended and is in jail, together with a few other cultists.

She will speak about the Zhentarim, how she was keeping contacts with Yorelor (already known info)





Ancient Battlefield §
Make a small dungeon and move the book there.
The battlefield has some undeads and a natural cave near there.
In the cave, a couple of exploration hazards plus the chamber with the powered book.
TODO

Dwarven text written with infernal text and common text. Instructions on how to operate the portal to Nulbuzar and modify it to connect to Dispater.
Find price of selling for the Sickle +2. 300 gp?

29 mar 23 §
Shindra will try to summon the Clockwork, will manage at end of turn 1.
Ludvic wants to try commanding the goliaths with its own commanding bracelet. I guess opposed arcana roll with Shindra and higher wins.
Log §
They found the rapier and encountered Shindra.
She summoned the Hell Hound and ordered the goliaths to kill them.
Fight begins.
22 mar 23 §
Ancient Forge
Remove combat with 2 automatons and make a puzzle instead. Maybe the pillars to reach the body are weakened and need some kind of reinforcement before passing through.
Log §
Finished 2nd floor, Madrick is without rage and Dreandian is empty slots. Others are full.
They have the bracelet to control the collars. They want to use it on Shindra.
15 mar 23 §
They will probably finish the 2nd and 3rd floor.
Start to prepare Ancient Battlefield as new adventure, use WWN. It can be partly in the forest, with some old buildings hit by the combat.
8 mar 23 §
They want to ask Joylon what he knows and will continue the dungeon.
After it has finished, Miran will declare his son the rightful heir and ask if he wants to come lead his people. If he refuses, the clan will wait for him to finish what he has started here, they will be waiting in their ancestral lands
Log §
They continued the fight and cleared the 1st floor. A single special guard will come with them, while the rest will remain outside guarding.
They know that Shindra is trying to summon an army of devils.

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Closed/Ancient-Forg.title: Ancient Forge
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Closed/Ancient-Forg.content:
Last floor §
Area 1 - Puzzle with navigation challenge §
Stone statue puzzle §


                   
                  Quote 
                  
                
A big statue of dwarven facture depicting a warrior is at the center. It has eyes made of ruby, but one is missing.  A side of the room has collapsed, showing an opening on the lava river. Some natural stone pillars are a few meters from the edge, leading to a regress with another similar statue. At the feet of this statue, the body of a Goliath lies immobile.

If scanned with wand of secrets, it reveals the opening in the statue.
If one of the ruby gems is placed in the central statue, a small door unlocks, showing an opening with a +1 Rapier of Furious Lava. It’s a normal +1 Rapier but as a bonus action can sprout some lava along its end, dealing an additional 1d10 fire damage. 5 charges, recharge at dawn. Needs identification first otherwise is a normal +1 Rapier.


                   
                  Quote 
                  
                
A rapier of very good make is within the statue. You can easily sense magic coming from it. It’s quite warm to the touch and a fine web of red cracks goes all along the blade.

Traversal puzzle on lava to dead Goliath §
Athletics or Acrobatics DC 15 by itself. If failed, dangling from edge.
Another check DC 13 to get up again and retry. If failed, drop in lava, 4d10 dmg.
Reward: §
On the body: 2x ruby gems of 20 gp each.
The Goliath fled from the Clockwork Abomination.


                   
                  Quote 
                  
                
A blooded note will say that he rebelled thanks to a defective collar but got wounded by the “Clockwork Abomination”. Fled to this spot to rest since it’s safe from it, but was dying from bleeding out. “Shindra wants an army of those monsters?? May Miran manage to save us, because I couldn’t. Maybe the Kingdom of To’kar will help us with devils, they are like demons in the end…” is written at the end.

Area 2 - Crevasse with sniper statue §
Traversal to cross the fallen bridge, they will find a way. Worst case scenario, they have Fly. There is a sniper among the statues.
If Madrick throws someone, Athletics DC 15. If failed, thrown person has Dex Saving Throw to attack to other side and climb up with another Athletics DC 13.
If falls inside, 4d10 dmg and is attached to side, requiring check again.
Further fails means you are stuck there, can’t move, no more damage.
Sniper is a reanimated stone statue, with gems in each eye. It’s missing one of the eyes gems.
It’s going to throw rocks at them to keep them out. It destroyed the bridge to slow them.


                   
                  Quote 
                  
                
Upon opening the door, you see a large hallway continuing towards a large door at the end. Where a bridge was supposed to be crossing the lava river, a big hole now is present, seemingly very recent.
Some statues on the sides and one on its center are blocking the way. The center one is quite big, bronze colored and has ruby gems in place of the eyes. One gem is missing though.
As soon as you start to process the problem of the missing bridge, the center statue moves, preparing to throw a large rock debris from the bridge at you. Dex Saving throw DC 10.

Final fight §
After 1 turn, Shindra summon the Adv Clockwork Abomination by using the control panel. They will keep coming until the control panel is turned off or the portal is closed some other way.
The Goliaths will try to block them and give them time. They are controlled by another bracelet on Shindra. Description of the father Miran. He has the collar and will do the all attacks against Madrick at disadvantage, because of resisting it. Describe sweating from him and serrated mounth, with undecided movements.
Shindra will summon the hound immediately before combat start. The imp will simply create noise and try to break concentration or fight with Rudolf.
Shindra will operate the console of the forge to increase the power of the lava heat to sacrifice the gold and ruby by melting it to “buy” devil troops.
The portal will remain open until it is shutdown from the controls or any other way. Manage as Skill Challenge during combat. Each turn the players can declare that they will try something to close the portal in the lava, using their entire action and doing a skill check. Or they can do the combat as normal.
REWARD
A Ring of Protection from Miran as a token of gratitude, with an invite to come back when ready, as future Chief of the Clan.
A 2000 gp worth of gold ore and raw rubies still intact.

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Closed/Dragon-Barro.title: Dragon Barrow Adv
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Closed/Dragon-Barro.content:
Linked to Dragon Barrow.
Objective §
Retrieve the Sword of the Dragon Slayer from the hidden catacomb.
TODO:
make pointcrawl of it as exploration challenge.
Decide reward from phandalin.
Hooks §
Mayor asks them to investigate the temple for clues on the legendary weapon.
They could see it while exploring Ancient Battlefield too.


                   
                  Quote 
                  
                
100 years ago another dragon gave some trouble to this area. It was called Azdraka, a green dragon.  The person, a noble Lady from Neverwinter, managed to kill it but was mortally wounded as well in the same Ancient Battlefield you already saw. Now an abandoned temple is there, left due to a terrible attack a few years ago at the local garrison.
It is said that her Sword has the power to kill dragons better than anything else, after absorbing the dragon’s soul. The sword and the owner burial were hidden on her request, but we might need a weapon like that.
We can pay for some work on your base or pay you X amount.

Complications §

The entrance is hidden. Wand of secrets, also some other traces of wear of some stone.
One of the killed soldiers has returned as a special undead.
The spirit of Lady Masah has been reawekened by Cryovain’s presence. She wants to test the PCs. They can give a summary of recent advs. She will ask for them to destroy the undead soldier and cleanse the catacomb.
The sword will be found immediately and can be taken immediately, but Lady Masah will attack since they are not worthy of it.
To reach the undead soldier, have some traversal or exploration issue.

Places §

Tomb of the Lady, adorned with many objects of her daily life and her warrior training.

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Ludvic's-trap-(TAC+.title: Ludvic's trap (TAC+MGME2e+EC)
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Ludvic's-trap-(TAC+.content:
Zhentarim react to destruction of investment in the Cult and a warning letter is sent to Ludvic anonymously by the family, as a trap. It’s a collaboration between Shadowcloaks Old Faction Sheet and Zhentarim.
Theme: major involvement of factions, discover their rivalry somehow. Investigation leading to neverwinter?
Phase 1 §
Once they arrive in Neverwinter, they see they have a bounty on their head by the city. Zhentarim are trying to frame them as members of the cult and putting the group out of businness.
They are not recognized immediately, but during shopping the owner says that they have a familiar face, even if none of them ever came here before.
A wanted board is noticed with the following written

After that, they will notice the posters with a 10k gp bounty. A group of bandits from Shadowcloaks Old Faction Sheet will ambush them at the same time. They recognize Ludvic. (combat can be with archers on rooftops with 3d map)
Phase 2 §
Back to Dwarven Vaults

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/GUM-Onesho.title: GUM Oneshot
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/GUM-Onesho.content:
GUM §
Location: Indoors, Manor, Castle
Background problem: Sabotage. Under Siege
Plot hook: Desperate request for help
Mission: Stop someone from doing wrong
Motivation for PCs: Money
Initial lead: Investigate location of recent event
Opposition: Need networking to find them
Caveat: Legendary enemy allied to their cause (Gigant)
Academy of Magical Research §
Focused on innovation and discovery. Magical.
Needs: Energy to run a defense system
Surplus: Trade goods, magical services.
Next Session: §

 improve combat encounter
 prep more descriptions for Kasmin’s Office
 prep some encounters if going out to recharge

Mystery Nodes & Clue List §
Based on Node-based Design & Mysteries
TODO for next time: Clue list is wrong, they should be for each scene, a list of clues only. Keep the rest out in a different note.

 (Ending) Kasmin is the assassin / Fight?

[ ]


 The Ritual Book (already found)

 Instructions to manipulate the weather with a ritual. Surprisingly easy to follow.


 Bram’s Diary (already found)

 Points to the existence of the Ritual Book


 Bram’s missing pages

 Bram decided to destroy the research (Stop the attack)
 Bram wanted to confront Kasmin about it, knowing it was going to be a bad news for him (Kasmin is the assassin)
 The Academy is in financial ruin almost (The Academy is in financial ruin)


 Laboratory

 R2 Has the Ritual Book
 Near one of the tables, on the ground there are traces of vines debris (Vine Creature)

 R7 Investigation DC 12: Some were cut by a knife or similar, which can be found nearby with traces of chlorophyll on it. Said knife is not really good at cutting like that, unlikely that the creature was created by a process here. No other traces of vines on other tools


 R4 Small wooden altar dedicated to Nature, with the symbol of the druidic circle. Bram was either a member or a faithful. A small note on it says: “For your newfound dedication. -Karkan”
 R3 Lots of empty chemical bottles with dust on it. Strange to have such a big lab without many basic ingredients.
 Vuglu - the Ice Construct CR 1
- Description: “A wooden automaton with a metal frame. Most of the chest area seems to be occupied by a large water tank, made of reinforced glass, the condensation on it indicates a very low temperature. Inside the water, a crystal floats, shining a good quantity of light around the construct. One of the arms is occupied by a cylindrical end, dripping water that quickly forms icicles from the edge. The other is a fist covered in a wooden chassis.”
- Components
- Wooden shell (10 HP)
- Core engine (5 HP, vital)
- On tank destruction, the crystal destabilizes, exploding in a 20 ft radius. Warning of 1 round. Dmg 1d12+2 cold
- Cannon arm (5 HP)
- 1 action, 30 ft ice cone, Dex save DC 11, 1d6 slashing. On fail, also immobilized. An Action to be freed or Strength DC 12
- Punch arm (5 HP)
- 1 action, Punch, atk +4, Dmg 1d10
- Legs (1 + 1 HP), 20 ft movement, 3


 Kasmin’s Office

 R4 Has Bram’s missing pages (Bram’s missing pages)
 R3 Log book of finances, showing the bad state of the Academy (Academy’s financial ruin)
 R1 Inside the financial book, a projection of very high profit coming from “Bram’s new Ritual” (Kasmin is the assassin & Bram’s missing pages)
 R5 Formal letters coming from the Circle of druids, lamenting damage to the surrounding area’s natural balance during Bram’s recent research. (Circle of the Waving Grass Organization)
 R6 A message of the King inside a talking letter, agreeing to come to help against the “druidic rebellion that has already made victims in the Academy. I hope losing Bram will not be a significant hit to the Academy”
 Grimask will find them thanks to the Alert spell, he is in charge of security.

 He will threaten them of being arrested, if revealed that Kasmin killed Bram, he becomes an ally.

 If threathened or attacked, will flee and search for help in Kasmin (CR 5 mage)




 If Kasmin discovers them, he will attack them, saying that he can’t let the secret get out.

 If Grimask is present, he will be attacked as well. “This Academy needs new blood anyway, easier than firing you”




 Magical Junction

 R5 Druidic scouts are there (Druidic Org), will alert the minotaur boss, they want the Ritual Book if they have it, damand to become their agents if not.
 Signs of magical rituals on the altar, unrelated to recharge of crystals (Magical shield is going down)
 These magical signs are still causing temperature and pressure fluctuations in the immediate area (Ritual book)


 Common Area (Hook)

 Crime scene of murder (found)
 R7 Vine Creature disassembled (Vine Creature origin)
 Erren the cook is a witness
 Erren saw the conversation between Karkan and Kasmin from afar, it was very short but he doesn’t know what was said ()


 The vine creature is evoked from magic (already found)
 (Ancillary) The magical shield is going down / Stop the attack
 The Academy is in financial ruin
 (Ancillary) The last conversation between Kasmin and Karkan

 The last conversation between Kasmin and Karkan the minotaur was very short, because Kasmin didn’t want to listen to him at all, threatening a fake accusation to have the King arrest them / ruin their reputation



Revelation List §

 R1 Kasmin’s the Killer

 The Office has Bram’s missing pages detailing the intention to renounce the discovery R4
 An accounting book showing balance consistently in red in last few years, saved by financing of the King R3


 R2 The Ritual Book has the weather control spell

 Testimony from  Grimask


 R3 Academy is on the brink of financial ruin (Motivation)
 R4 Bram decided to renounce
 R5 The druids want to destroy the Ritual Book
 R6 Kasmin wants to use the King intervention to remove the druid’s opposition
 R7 The vine creature is fake

NPCs §
Erren Emberlight: Elf, Cook, Scared impression, wants to give info, owns supplies. Witness of murder.

What he knows:
 Witnessed murder

 “I was getting ready”


 Kasmin has been under stress due to financial state of the Academy
[ ]

Grimask: Half Orc, Castle engineer, intimidating impression, wants to assist PCs, wearing uniform of Faction.

What he knows:
 The Castle is protected by a magic cupola, no way an external creature might have entered like that.
 The energy to keep the shield in place is failing, need to go out and recharge the other crystal doing a ritual.
[ ]

Kasmin Swifthide: Gnome, Head of researchers, angry impression, wants to teach or give info, owns a magical special item (weather control rod?), CR 5 mage

What he knows:
 He killed Bram to avoid him leveraging political support to block the weather control rod development
 The Academy is under financial debt, being years since the last discovery to sell to others.
 reate a narrative against the Circle. The Shield should keep up until the nearby kingdom arrives to help. After that, they have a good story to sell to the King and to sell Weather Books.

Bram: Human, promising researcher, timid.

 Killed by Kasmin
 Hide the book with his research of weather control and its ritual
[ ]

Circle of the Waving Grass §
Driving focus: Harmony with location. Naturalist types?
Needs: Prophecy. A way to control the weather discovered by Academy of Magical Research. They want to block this.
Surplus: Nature. Affinity with it.
NPCs §
Karkan: Minotaur, Head of druidic order, confused, wants to protect nature.
Wants to see the weather spell forgotten.
The Murder §
A human called Bram, researcher, has been killed in the laboratory.
Findings:

 Traces of herbs are on his body

 Invetigation, Nature, Perception check. Upon better look, the pattern of contact indicates that the herbs were sprinkled after the body was down.


 Killed by a wooden vine projectile to the heart.
 A diary, with the chronicle of his research on weather control magic, to improve predictability for farmers.

 The last few pages have been removed. (Owned by Kesmin)
 Last readable page speaks about being way behind on creating something functional.
 Actual last page details how the latest proto is working and needs to be destroyed to avoid destabilizing the weather with too much use.


 Erren witnessed the attack by a wooden creature. After killing him, it deconstructed on the ground as a bunch of vines without traces of magic left.

 Arcana to see magic absence.
 Nature skill to notice how this type of magic is not practiced by the Circle, since Ents are grown out of trees, not from vines.



LazyDM §
Review the characters

 Review the characters
 Create a strong start

 The construct is seeing them as intruder, he only recognize Bram as non hostile.
 He will reanimate the objects if combat is too easy.


 Outline potential scenes

 Kasmin Office

 “A delightfully classic study room, full of high quality wood that looks quite unkept and has begun to fade. A layer of finish is long due. Many books are scattered along desks, some on the ground in an unexpected chaos given the orderly look of everything else, as if a recent flurry of activity was yet to be reordered”
 (If searching, no check) Inside one of the books, a few detached pages are found, they are the missing pages from Bram’s diary.

 They detail how he decided to renounce his research and destroy his discovery to avoid giving this power to the highest bidder.
 Last paragraph: “I know Kasmin is going to be furious and the Academy will be in danger of bankruptcy, but this is the right thing to do. I’ll communicate to him my decision today, then I will inform Karkan to placate him” (date of 4 days ago)
 Encounter:

 Grimask will find them thanks to the Alert spell, he is in charge of security.
 He will threaten them of being arrested, if revealed that Kasmin killed Bram and becomes an ally.
 If threathened or attacked, will flee and search for help in Kasmin (CR 5 mage)






 Laboratory

 Spill of acid ongoing, each round a new area is filled. Acid makes 2d6 damage if passing through or finishing turn there.
 Near one of the tables, on the ground there are traces of vines debris

 Investigation DC 12: Some were cut by a knife or similar, which can be found nearby with traces of chlorophyll on it.




 Magical Juncture Clearing

 The druids and circle will find them and try to stop recharging. They need to hold for 3 rounds while the crystal recharges (emits lots of light while charging), then combat ensues.

 Goblins (Use flee mortals ones)
 Minotaur druid (flee mortal + spells)






 Define secrets and clues
 Develop fantastic locations
 Outline important NPCs
 Choose relevant monsters
 Select magic item rewards



 Review the characters
 Create a strong start

 After finding the body of Bram, Grimask enters the dining room, yelling about an army closing in. He just activated the Magic Shield.
 The siege has been ongoing for a few moments before the head of the druidic circle booms his voice inside the Castle:
“Give us the Ritual Book of Bram or we will need to take it by force. You have until dawn.”
 Insight check: Everyone seems quite scared, but Kesmin seems to be more busy thinking about something.

 Retrieve the Book from Bram’s Laboratory

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/SWN/Sci-fi.title: Sci-fi oneshot
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/SWN/Sci-fi.content:
Recap §
They found a way to enter the Security Sector, found the prisons and freed 3 workers prisoners.
One of them is Rebel Leader, Oliver Leeroy. He will help with them attacking the security control room.
TODO:
Define final encounter in control room.
Also define another scene.
Overview §
From SWN Adventure Creation chapter
Conflict Type: Money
Overall Situation: Sudden profit opportunity arises
Specific Focus: Corrupt officials want it
Restraint (why still not resolved?): One side’s still licking their wounds after a failure
Twist: PC’s main contact is mistrusted by their allies
Situation §
Asteroid Refinery TR-34 is one of many asteroid mining bases controlled by Mintech Corp.
Faction 1 is people, Faction 2 is Corrupt officials of said company.
Recent events: People tried revolting, some got killed and captured.
PCs are recently arrived after Patron has asked for help in giving the mine to the people.
Patron is mistrusted by people because he is a opportunist merchant.
Define using Transclude of Prep-workflow#situations
Inhabitants §

Rebelling workers hiding in the mining sector.
Security officers,
Security droids, some are

Behaviours §
Rebelling workers are patrolling the area
Goal of PCs §
Potential Complications §
Last session:
they have a prisoner pilot.
They arrived at the docks, found the Merchant and he asked to find repair droids for the ship.
They are exploring the Common Sector. Other sectors are Security (with Hospital and Control Security Room for droids) and Mining.
There is a communications blackout, but they can still hack by wire.
TODO:
decide some more scenes while in the Common area. A skill based one, maybe with the medical droid found and hacked.
A scene for the Mining Sector.
A scene for the Security Sector, once opened.
Lazy DM Steps §

Review the characters

They want to repair their ship and go away. Service bots have been moved to Security Sector.


Create a strong start

They start ambushed by corporate ships, on order of killing any external threat.
They start exploring the empty common areas, when some security droids enter the area, patrolling, when gravity goes away momentarily if something happens.

If droids see them, they are invited to be escorted to the Security Sector waiting area, while awaiting whitelisting or arrest, because they are not registered as miners (rebels)




Outline potential scenes

While exploring the docking area, a security droid team patrols nearby. Give warning.
Entering a fortified sector of Mintech Corp to retrieve information
If PCs try to enter Security Sector, security droids tell them about the ID and whitelist
PCs try to reactivate the refueling operations
Rebels attack the security sector



Define secrets and clues

Automated security is the main control means of MinTech Corp
Few officers are on the asteroid, they isolated in the Security sector.
A SOS signals has been sent to MinTech Corp. Standard procedure is to kill everyone when they arrive to rescue VIPs.
Security has been used to stop a revolt
People are not getting paid since 6 months ago
Revolt has been used as excuse to condemn people to forced work (aka slave labor)
Any small infraction is used to increase penalty time of workers
The control room of the droids is heavily guarded from standard attacks
One officer has a key to access the droids controls
- Patron merchant is trying to reactivate the repairing droids to repair his ship.
- Access to Security Sector is blocked to everyone without a MinTech Corp ID and manual clearance from Chief Officer Cyris to whitelist.
Security Sector has prisons with captured revolting workers.
Some workers have hidden in the mine’s tunnels, ambushing androids and PCs.
Wire has access data to the Security Sector


Develop fantastic locations

Common areas with artificial gravity on both floor and ceiling. Some places are malfunctioning.
Mining sector with rebelling workers hidden.
Security sector under lockdown and high security measures activated


Outline important NPCs

Patron merchant, Rayven

Wants to flee the Refinery


Chief Officer, Cyris Trawn (Sec Sector)

Hunkering down until reinforcements arrive. Blocking the docks refueling.


Rebel Leader, Oliver Leeroy (Mining Sector)

Trying to conquer the facility to reactivate anti ship defenses


Broken Medical droid, Wire

Lost vision sensors, so can be tricked in giving information

Security turret
Medical droids

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/The-Factor.title: The Factory
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Oneshots/The-Factor.content:
TODO: §

 Define better the possible scenes and locations, also NPCs
 Define Mythic List and EC list for location exploration
 Define some premade situations (combat + puzzles) to be used as backup in case EC is too slow to use live

 Announce that I will be improvising some locations as a test


 Define some cool magic items to find during the adventure
 Define 4 premade PC
 Put everything in a “run-time” note for ease of use

A factory of wood working is attacked and taken control while PCs are there. The factory defense systems are used against them, they want to abduct some NPC, maybe the owner of the factory?
Plot twist, the attackers want to free their own people, which are enslaved by the owner NPC in a secret floor of the building/place.
They could be kobolds, who have a good inventive and are captured to work as slaves.
Everyone on the outside of the town knows that the factory uses some simple constructs to work. Those publicly viewable are not that great though.
Factory purpose? Wood working. Refine everyday object and forniture for the local town and bigger city nearby.
Session end: §
They reached the control room. There is some water inside at ankle level. Room is divided in 2 levels with desks with control magical devices for the constructs.
There are 4 constructs (2 water, 2 security).
One of them is special, a kobold is controlling him gundam style. This is the ice-spewing one, the cone attack does ice damage and restrain who fails the dex save. Action to liberate or be liberated.
Also the kobold chief is there. Will send groups of minion kobolds as a commander. Look at MCDM book for inspiration.
TO DO/IMPROVE: §
Location Crafter is generating too many useless pieces.

 Either switch to some pointcrawl generator or use LC as structured instead, pre-generating room network.

 Network can be improvised, but I should have them as structured, not randomized. Expected results don’t help much, they can be a good fallback if I want to decrease strangeness of a result, but I can do that on my own.


 Prep: Prepare combat with modified component-based water hose.
 Add more info in data of monsters, to avoid calculations during fight
 Prep: During combat, the floor is destroyed by ice or explosives and they will fall into the lower level

 Explosive traps are placed around the room, Perception DC 14 to find them. They can be destroyed/deactivated to avoid collapse.



Lazy DM checklist §

Create a strong start

PCs are attending the inauguration of the recent upgrade of the factory using worker constructs, where the owner is also introduced. The kobolds attack and kidnap the owner as hostage, going inside the factory.


Outline potential scenes

Initial scene with the attack. Could be a fast combat with some basic kobolds. They will see a group of kobolds go inside the factory at the start of combat. There are groups of recently laid-off workers that are manifesting outside.
Factory main entrance, closed from inside. There are some kobolds throwing arrows to everyone that gets close. Could enter by force or by searching a secondary entrance. TotM
While exploring the factory, the constructs are turned against the PCs
An hostage situation with some employees, “We want justice!”
Alarmed area with secrets of the factory. Alarm calls the guards and special security construct
An underground toxic workshop for initial treatment of logs and the slaves work on them. Some townguards are controlling them, already on high alert from alarm.
A hallway full of kobold traps, well visible but hard to traverse due to many wires

The Owner is a bad person, more focused on money than on the wellbeing of their employees
The town guards, under the lead of the Sheriff, are mainly focused on the factory’s security instead of the town
The constructs are not very efficient or ready to work alone yet. They tend to become aggressive or act dumb when executing commands.
The Sheriff has been promoted thanks to the influence of the Owner a few years ago.
The factory releases many polluting agents in the nearby river
The Owner is trying to hide the low dependability of the constructs to the town while his employees work on them

Starting scene §

Scene 2 §

Make component based ones too + basic grunts


Guards

Make component based ones too + basic grunts. Components based on equipment?




TAC Seed §

Turning point:

A MOTIVE FREE CRIME    (MYSTERY)

A crime is committed either in this Turning Point or is learned about in this Turning Point, with no clear reason why the crime was committed. Maybe someone was murdered for no obvious reason, or a building was broken into with nothing stolen.


A CHARACTER IS ATTACKED TO ABDUCT    (ACTION)

An assailant is attempting to abduct a Character.


FRENETIC ACTIVITY    (ACTION)

This Turning Point involves action coming fast and furious at a Character. It should be a rapid fire succession of action, for instance a series of attackers, an out of control boat rocketing down a rapids approaching peril after peril, running a gauntlet of some kind through a series of traps, etc.


CHARACTER HAS A CLEVER IDEA    (ACTION)

A Character has an idea that has an impact on this Turning Point. For instance, the con man speaks up and just happens to know a secret way through the sewers into the walled city.


USED AGAINST THEM    (TENSION)

A resource owned or aligned with one Character is somehow turned against them in this Turning Point. For instance, a small starship is being pursued by three massive battle cruisers. By skillful piloting, the smaller ship causes the larger ships to collide with each other, using their size against them. Or, a wizard may command a powerful golem, but another wizard casts a spell to make the golem attack its master.

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Shadowcloaks'-Heist.title: Shadowcloaks' Heist
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Shadowcloaks'-Heist.content:
The group has started smelting all the golden ore stolen by the Cult at the city.
They have attracted a lot of attention by hiring all the smelters available and be quick.
Shadowcloaks will know about it and about Ludvic’s presence.
They will steal half the gold from a smelter, leaving traces at the place.
This way PCs can track them down to the sewers.
It’s a lot of gold, so they will try to hide their traces.
General Theme

Retrieve lost gold
Investigate location, ask witnesses and complices.

 Handle as mystery, make a list of NPCs and side stories for each.
