D&D-Campaign/Threads/The-Surgeon-(Tome-A.title: The Surgeon
D&D-Campaign/Threads/The-Surgeon-(Tome-A.content:
Reference: Tome of Adv Design
Location and Hook §
1-1a Location Overview
Crumbling Hatcheries of the Fiery Surgeon
1-6 Location-Based Missions
Defend from attack, Dungeon or Fort
1-8 Patron
Explorer
1-9 Motivations
Reconciliation with Spiritual Leader
1-10 Hook
Provide needed equipement. Sent dream suggests the opportunity in clear terms, but without revealing who sent the dream or why.
Villain’s Plan §
1-11 Master plan: Conversion. The villain is trying to convert others to his way of thinking.
1-13 Conversion plan: Enchantment. Magically enchanting people and persuading/ordering evil acts.
Probably wants their souls as fuel for something. Maybe to make powerful potions. A powered one is given to all thugs.
1-35: Minions:
Nature: Thug
Unusual Characteristic: Highly superstitious
Reason of loyalty: Addicted to substance provided by villain. The water in the cistern heals from illnesses, but causes addiction and slowly transform in bird-like creatures.
Interpretation:
This demon or fey is charming people and transforming some in some bird-like hybrid to use as thugs. The inner circle is charmed while the general population is simply religious and superstitious.
Some fanatics are letting themselves die of hunger in cages to have their soul saved. The Surgeon is using them as fuel to craft something.
Ruin §
4-10 Condition: Crumbling
4-11 Type: Village
4-12 Unusual Purpose: Wizard’s Stronghold
Actually the Surgeon’s Stronghold
4-13: Current Purpose: Holy site for a secretly sect
Worshippers of this demon who is saying to be a god with some healing magic
4-14: Structures:
1d6 cottages + 1d10 cottages + 1d10 cottages: 19 cottages + Inn
Also a temple, made from the remains of a water cistern structure
It’s a very small village, not an actual ruin, but it’s pretty run down and poor, RE4 style village.
A small map can be created with the watabou generator.
4-18 Pride of the Town: Wine
4-20 Odd customs of dress: Applies to all visitors, Item of silverware to bring on display at all times.
4-21 Odd behavior: Avoid all eye contact.
4-22 Unusual Cultural Center of Gravity: Actual worship of ruling class.
Dungeon under the village §
3-1 Time element:
The characters have an ally or information source who will be discovered or shut down after a certain period of time (a traitor in the bandit stronghold who will certainly be discovered soon, for example)
3-2 Motivational element/hook
Curiosity and freeing people / loot
Starting info of the party: They arrive in the village during travel, a corpse of an inhabitant is found in the middle of the road with evident signs of bestial attack. No one cares, actually they consider him negatively for minor reasons when asked.
3-3 Tactical Challenges:
Worry about breaking.
3-4 Specific Tactical Situations
Areas in which standard abilities are weakened (passive maluses or weakened effects)
Transclude of Tome-of-Adv-Design#the-map
Area 1, Outer area, “The Dreaming Cathedral” §
Rough, excavated through rock.
7 rooms, 2 unusual size.
Normal rooms

Rectangle 20x40ft X
Square 30x30 X
Rectangle 20x30 X
Rectangle 20x30 X
Square 30x30 X
Rectangle 20x40 X
Rectangle 20x30 X

Unusual Size

Octagon, 120 ft across X
Square, 60x60 X

Arrangement §
Connecting corridor forms a square, circle, or rectangle (i.e., it surrounds an internal area). About half the rooms are enclosed by the corridor, and the other half enter onto the outside wall of the corridor.
Landmarks §

Big Thing: The Defaced Ice Well (octagonal room, the well is the access to the connecting cave)

Some ice themed water enemy is here, blocking the way. It’s too big to chase PCs in the corridors. Can be weakened by info provided in room 3 and 8.
The Well has knee deep water and is difficult terrain for PCs.
Bringing the Urn waters into the Well will remove it’s control on the water, stopping his ice carapace skill.



Strange Thing: The Chessboard of Nightmares
Special Room: Lighting, NPC Interaction.

Glowing statues
NPC:

Is in a very perilous or precarious situation due to trap or architecture – probably trapped in place
Initial attitude: hostile, ready to fight
Value to party: Can give treasure to party or act as diplomat/interlocutor for them with a strong monster elsewhere.
Interpretation: Can be a trapped monster with ranged attacks, PCs need to find a way to free him to kill and get treasure

Or can be a stationary monster acting as a mini boss with weak spots using component based stat blocks. Weak spots need to be reached or hit at distance to open an initial carapace that bounces all enemies.






Empty (dressing) (Entrance)
Empty (dressing)
Special: Furniture, Clue to figure out

Clue

Why location became dungerous: Original inhabitants departed, After contact with sinister being (Surgeon), 10 years ago


Furniture type: Fire Pit, Made of Bronze of other metal


Strange Thing: The Confusion Carvings
Special: NPC Interaction, Container with interesting contents

Containers

Numerous choices of large containers, some with special features

Large Basket
Large Urn: Concealed somehow, located amidst duplicates and there is a race against time to find the right one

Time issue: One of PCs suffers from a disease/curse/poison that has increased effect overtime






NPC Interaction

Imprisoned
Initial attitude: Response is affected by enchantement/drug/illusion, whatever it may be.
Value to party: gives information, about backstory of the place and its builders


Interpretation: An inhabitant which poisons one of the PCs and gives them the need to prove that they are worthy. Secret clues on which Urn is there, all the Urns are magical but the wand of secrets will point directly to the good one. Each time they open the wrong urn and drink what is inside, the cursed PC takes damage as if it was a comparable CR monster attack with quick stats.


Special: Pillars, architectural trick with dramatic central element

Pillar: contains fossils, human shaped (Skeleton shaped holding them ceiling)
Trick:

Central feature: Altar. On top glowing amphibians in glass globes. On sides the text of a mythical story (about the Surgeon. Add clue here about his skills.)
Dramatic feature: Walls with dramatic color.


Interpretation: Needs to give some clues on Surgeon or other enemies.

Ice Golem
Legendary CR 8

If both legs are destroyed, 10ft crawling speed

D&D-Campaign/Threads/The-Undead-Mages.content:
Main points §

Old enemies of the city, brought back accidentally by Cryovain. Trying to conquer the city by raising more undeads.
4 Mages, each focused on an Element. Mainly conjurers and necromancers.

They are hunting people in the Chasm to raise as undeads.
Killing them and raising directly, no prisoners.
TODO:

 Choose spells for mages
 Define encounter dynamic

 Environment, things going on externally


 Give intelligence and personality
 Make backgrounds! And connections between them.
 Add 1 magic item to each.

Yelfir, Ice Mage §

Open area
Theme: Getting slowdown by cold
People clinging to fire, being attacked
Frozen themed undeads
Environment: Frozen terrain, difficult to move, requires Dex ST DC 11 to not fall prone after moving if not stabilized somehow.
Description:
“As you approach the area, the temperature drops considerably, showing the individual breaths coming out of your mouths. The area soon after starts to be covered in snow and ice, making a very difficult place to traverse.
As you make your way in the area, the buildings begin to most transform in groups of icy debris and pieces of rock, out from the recent Chasm formation. In doing so, you see a faint trail of smoke coming out of a dilapidated house, screams of fighting and noises of undeads. A group of undead soldiers are around the house, from which some lights from fires come from. On top of a frozen wooden platform, another robed undead is visible.
This old and desiccated human is covered in a layer of thin ice, still showing the old robes under him. No spellbook is visible on his figure but he has a wand in his hand, a crown on his head and a shiny belt. All these three elements are more
Background: He was one of the best elemental mages of the time, tried to remove his emotions with the stillness of cold.




Statblock Ice Mage

Ice Armor

Raising Wand (attack source, ranged, raises as undeads any killed creature)

Atk+8, Dmg 2d12 necrotic


Ice Hand (Melee, a sword-shaped ice piece around the arm)

Atk+8, Dmg 2d10 cold


Icy Eye Crown (ranged ice ray attack, 2/day)

Atk+6, Dmg 4d8, 30 ft Line, Const ST DC 13 or frozen in place for 1 minute. Repeat at end of turn.


Ice Wall belt (create an ice wall in front of him. Holds the belt with both hands to activate), Concentration 10 min

https://5e.tools/spells.html#wall%20of%20ice_phb




Mage misty steps around
No counterspell
Damage resistance: cold, necrotic, poison (immune)
Weaknesses: fire
Reward:


The Icy Eye Crown has 5 charges left.
Ice Wall belt has 5 charges.
Raising Wand can be normally used.

Raised undeads:

Chill Touch spell on contact https://5e.tools/spells.html#chill%20touch_phb
Weak and cannon fodder

Vajeon, Fire Mage §
TODO:

Statblock
Map

Theme: Summons fire creatures.
Situation: Fighting a group of the Order of the Gauntlet.
Description:
“Arrived on the spot where the smoke is coming from, the area has been completely stripped away of any type of grass or worked pavement, only dry earth remains. A few trees are still green, but quickly veering towards a dead brown due to the intense heat. The heat is coming from a river of lava that seems to be emerging from the earth, a mere meter under the level of the terrain. A ruined building is near it and seems to be surrounded by knights of the Order of the Gauntlet. Some dead soldiers already on the ground, half burnt.
Inside a gnome with desiccated skin, currently on fire, even if his undead flesh doesn’t seem to consume away. He wears worn robes, resistant to fire even if with many traces of burnt spots.
With him, a good amount of creature, both inside and outside the building, all of some kind of fire origin. The battle is ongoing and the knights seems to be attacking a well defended position.”

Knight https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#knight_mm



Statblock Ice Mage

Ice Armor

Skull Staff (attack source, ranged, a burnt wooden staff with a half skull on top, with glowing red eyes, summons a creature)

Atk+8, Dmg 2d12 fire




Mage misty steps around in a puff of ashes
Fireball
Fire Wall
No counterspell
Damage immunity: fire, necrotic
Weaknesses: cold
Reward:


Broken Skull Staff: after defeating the Fire Mage, the pact with the Fire beings is broken, losing the summoning power and breaking the staff in half. It still has the ability to give fire resistance to the wearer, becoming akin to a wand.

Fengeiros, Wind Mage §
Theme: Difficult to pin down, very fast, flies. Crowd control with wind gusts and tornadoes.
Race: Elf

Drahbin the Earth Mage (defeated) §
Theme: He uses earth magic to empower himself.
During Phase 1, https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#mud%20mephit_mm Mud Mephits are present as mud specters of killed people, each can summon another one, so max 3 starting.
Synergy between Mud Breath of Mephits and burrow out.



Phase 1

Protected by a layer of earth and rocks.
CR 6.
18 AC, 100HP, atk+7, 35 damage (6d8 bludgeoning)
Strong melee combat which burrows and does ambushes, large size.
Telegraphed burrow attack

Turn 1: Burrows
Turn 2: Quickly travel underground, creating a small earthquake, making everywhere difficult terrain.
Roll 2d12 (distance) and 1d12 for direction. Starting from the center, that’s the spot he will come out.
Turn 3: Everyone on the squares occupied make Dex ST DC 14 or 2d10 damage.  In a 20 feet radius, same or 1d10 damage for the exploding debris.
Turn 4: No movement, recharges from exhaustion, vulnerable state. Does only normal attacks to adjacent foes. Return to turn 1




Phase 2 (creates some more mud mephits)

Lost the rock layer, the undead human mage is vulnerable
CR 6
14 AC, 100HP, atk+9, 35 damage (6d8 slashing)
AoE attack (Earthball spell) https://5e.tools/spells.html#fireball_phb
Wall spell https://5e.tools/spells.html#wall%20of%20stone_phb for CC
Misty step for mobility (bonus action) https://5e.tools/spells.html#misty%20step_phb



Golem type mage. He burrows and has a supply of undeads coming out from moved earth mounds.
Magical power is self-powering
Tactics: burrow and ambush, make buildings fall on PCs (2d10 damage)
TODO:

 Generate image

 Prompt used for reference: “earth golem, covered in rocks and dirt, dynamic striking pose, glowing runes on body”, juggernautXL model


 Create token in Foundry (image already on imgur)
 Define spells
 He is a self empowering mage, magic is used to power himself in combat
 Has high AC when in Protection mode, covered in rock
 2 modes: Protection mode (Large, high AC) and Attack mode (Medium, high damage, can misty step using burrowing actions)
 Can animate some small earth mephits from corpses

D&D-Campaign/Threads/Torian's-Descendanc.title: Torian's Descendance
D&D-Campaign/Threads/Torian's-Descendanc.content:
Torian Firgon wants to prove his descendance from Lady Masah Dankhud but the document listing the detailed family history of the Lady has been secreted by the Neverwinter Government to keep the current Council status quo.
The seat of the Lady is still empty.
The document is in the treasury of one of the members, heavily guarded. Technically on private lands.

D&D-Campaign/Threads/WWN-Adventure.title: WWN Adventure
D&D-Campaign/Threads/WWN-Adventure.content:
Fractal Seed:
93. A Place conceals its true nature as a very different
Place, and a Friend has been misfortunately taken
in by it.
Zoom on second Place:
85. A Place is being reclaimed by a Friend from its current difficulties, but an Enemy has reasons to oppose that change and is using a Complication to interfere.
Result:
A Place conceals its true nature as a very different Place. That fake Place is being reclaimed by a Friend from its current difficulties, but an Enemy has reason to oppose that change and is using a Complication to interfere. That Friend has been misfortunately taken in by the Place.
Variables:
Fake Place
True Place
Friend
Enemy
Complication
Fake Place:
Ruin.
Tags: False Front and Hospitable Natives.

What locals think of it? It plays a role in some important ritual.
How it become ruined? A plague or curse made it inhabitable.
Why not plundered yet? Its true entrance is unknown.
How old? Generations old.
Type of Ruin? Wizard tower or occult stronghold.
Previous users? Smugglers seeking a good stash spot.

True Place:
Tags: Feral Magic and Invincible Delusion.
Situation:
In a small village grown around a wizard tower. The tower is invisible or in pocket dimension and not reachable at first. It has hospitable habitants, but they are under the influence of some curse\magic effect that is giving them some delusion.
Enemy is the wizard in the tower, which is using the habitants for experiments, wiping their memory each time.
Friend is someone that was investigating but had the memory wiped out and added to the experiments.
TODO fill up Friend, Enemy and Complication from tags.

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Neverwinter-.title: Neverwinter Government
D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Neverwinter-.content:
Overview §
The actual lords of the Council are not attentive of the population and day to day operations are kept by the major figures.
Court tags §
Main Theme: Decadence of excess and indulgence
3 Major figures
Minor figures (hook providers, color and agents of majors)
Major Figures §

Court Mage Saira Berners

Source of Power: The others fear violence from them.
A very refined human politician, expert of rapier combat / fioretto.

Wants: Destabilization of the city (Zhentarim).
Assets: A web of magical informers spy on everyone in the court.


Look: Middle aged woman with a generally fit body thanks to the fioretto training. Keeps her white hairs in a chignon. Good quality robes, always well kept.


Cadet Branch Lord Drake Reviers

Source of Power: Acknowledgement of skill and brilliance
Look: Dwarf with a measured way of talking and not very talkative. Missing left arm from a past combat.

Wants: Training of a bigger army against nearby kingdoms




Jester Devlyn Cely

Source of Power: Access to sinister sorceries or magic items



Minor Figures §

Assistant Tate Bolbec

Hanger-on (social climber/supporter of someone else)
Lover of Saira Berners.


Footman
House Guard
Hired Assassin

Works for Devlyn.


Affiliated Merchant

Conflicts §
Internal §

A danger exists in or near the court’s own seat
Someone got involved with a criminal organization (Zhentarim)

External §

An important faith is angry with the court over something
A rival has seized control of an important court asset

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Order-of-the.title: Order of the Gauntlet
D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Order-of-the.content:
https://forgottenrealms.fandom.com/wiki/Order_of_the_Gauntlet
PCs know about their existence and that they are fighting the Zhentarim.
They were originally the corp of Neverwinter Champions, an elite fighting unit of the Council. Some veterans retired and formed the Order, which absorbed all duties of the Champion while becoming an external entity to the government.
Stats §
Size: Medium
Tag: Martial. The faction is profoundly devoted to war. It rolls an extra die for all Force attribute checks. Force must always be its highest attribute.

































StatValueCunning2Force6Wealth5MagicLowTreasure2HP23
Earning: W*0.5+(C+F) / 4 rounded up.  4.5 → 5
Assets §
Current:

Cunning: 1
Force: 3
Wealth: 1


Knights: Elite warriors of considerable personal prowess have been trained or enlisted by the faction, either from noble sympathizers, veteran members, or amenable mercenaries.

16 HP. FvF/2d8 damage. Counter 2d6 dmg.
Location: Neverwinter High district.


Fortification Program: A program of organized fortification and supply caching has been undertaken around the Asset’s location, hardening allied communities and friendly Assets. Once per turn, when an enemy makes an Attack that targets the faction’s Force rating, the faction can use the Fortification Program to defend if the Asset is within a turn’s move from the attack.

18 HP. Counter 2d6 damage. Action.
Location: Neverwinter Artisanal district.


Healers: Whenever an Asset within one move of the Healers is destroyed by an Attack that used Force against the target, the owner of the Healers may pay half its purchase price in Treasure, rounded up, to instantly restore it with 1 hit point. This cannot be used to repair Bases of Influence.

8 HP. Action.
Location: Neverwinter Commerce district.


Free Company: Hired mercenaries and professional soldiers, this Asset can, as a free action once per turn, move itself. At the start of each of its owner’s turn, it takes 1 Treasure in upkeep costs; if this is not paid, roll 1d6. On a 1-3 the Asset is lost, on a 4-6 it goes rogue and will move to Attack the most profitable-looking target. This roll is repeated each turn until back pay is paid or the Asset is lost.

6 HP. W v. F/2d4+2 damage. Counter 1d6 damage. Action, Special.
Location: Arfalls.


Local Guard. Ordinary citizens are enlisted into night watch patrols and local guard units. They’re most effective when defending from behind a fortified position, but they have some idea of how to use their weapons.

4 HP. F v. F/1d3+1 damage. Counter 1d4+1 damage.
Location: Neverwinter High district



Bases of Influence §

Order fortress HQ in Neverwinter High district. Hall of Justice.

HP 23/23.



NPCs §

Leader: Seraphina de Bernai
Lieutenant. Torian Firgon

Goal §

Expand Influence. Plant a Base of Influence at a new location. Difficulty 1, +1 if a rival contests it.

Faction log §

Destroyed Zhentarim Pleaders in Neverwinter High District.

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.content:
Overview §
What they want: §
Abolir wants to dominate a portion of Material Plane.
What events will they trigger without PCs intervention: §

Capture Phandalin and use as staging ground for invading Neverwinter

How do they accomplish these actions: §
Open a portal to the material plane, bring players to the fire plane.
Important NPCs involved (friendly or hostile to PCs) §

Abolir

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.title: Cult of Dispater
D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.content:
Overview §
What they want: §
Start a demonic invasion to conquer the Sword Coast.
What events will they trigger without PCs intervention: §
They will complete preparatives to repair and activate a big portal of an older cult.
A demonic invasion will start, attacking Phandalin, then Arfalls, then Neverwinter.
How do they accomplish these actions: §
They need slaves and materials to restore the portal location. They have conquered the Inulanat Clan for the slaves and have now control of Phandalin for the materials.
They are sending them to Shirine of Savras to avoid suspicions and then to another
Important NPCs involved (friendly or hostile to PCs) §
Miran “Treebreaker” Inulanat

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.title: Inulanat Clan
D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.content:
Home clan of Madrick Rootmuncher, Goliath Barbarian.
Led by Miran “Treebreaker” Inulanat.
Update 1 §
Madrick Rootmuncher, Goliath Barbarian is going to be the next leader. While he is out adventuring, Miran will continue to guide the people.

D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.title: Plant Supremacists TBD
D&D-Campaign/World/Factions/Secondary-Fa.content:
A group from Neverwinter which used plant magic to transform the south portion of the domains in an enormous swamp. They try to destabilize all governments with sabotaging and terrorism.
Tone: Think Poison Ivy, but it’s a cult.

They tried to send drow mercenaries to kill him once.

Size: Medium
Tag: Innovative: The faction can purchase Assets as if their attribute ratings were two points higher than they are. Only two such over-complex Assets may be owned at any one time.

Force: 1

Court Patronage: Powerful nobles or officials are appointing their agents to useful posts of profit.

A Court Patronage Asset automatically grants 1 Treasure to its owning faction each turn.
8 HP. CvsC/1d6 dmg. Counter 1d6 dmg. Subtle, Special.
Location: High quartiers of Neverwinter.


Spymaster: A veteran operative runs a counterintelligence bureau in the area and formulates offensive schemes for the faction.

4 HP. CvsC/1d6 dmg. Counter 2d6 dmg. Subtle.
Location: Neverwinter Commerce district


Thugs: These gutter ruffians and common kneebreakers have been organized in service to the faction’s causes.

1 HP. FvsC/1d6 dmg. Subtle.
Location: Neverwinter Slums district.


Front Merchant: Whenever the Front Merchant successfully Attacks an enemy Asset, the target faction loses 1 Treasure, if they have any, and the Front Merchant’s owner gains it. Such a loss can occur only once per turn.

3 HP. WvsW/1d4 dmg. Counter 1d4-1 dmg. Subtle.
Location: Neverwinter Commerce district.


Informers: As a free action, once per turn, the faction can spend 1 Treasure and have the Informers look for Stealthed Assets. To do so, the Informers pick a faction and make a Cunning vs. Cunning Attack on them. No counterattack damage is taken if they fail, but if they succeed, all Stealthed Assets of that faction within one move of the Informers are revealed.

3 HP. CvC / Special. Subtle, Special.
Location: Phandalin.


Cooperative Businesses. If any other faction attempts to create an Asset in the same location as a Cooperative Business, the cost of doing so increases by 1 Treasure. This penalty stacks.

2 HP. W v. W/1d4-1 damage. Subtle, Special.
Location: Phandalin.

HQ. Sewers under the Commerce district. Hidden behind magically hidden door, must know password to pass.

HP: 25/25


Phandalin Base.

HP 6/6

Klara Ex wife of Ludvic. Developed a relationship with the former head and betrayed him to become the chief. She hates Ludvic and wants him dead for abandoning her. She wants the “world to burn” after being abandoned and will use the Shadowcloaks to bring Neverwinter in anarchy.
Katerina. Daughter of Ludvic. She works as an agent, managing the various Merchant Fronts recycling money in Neverwinter and Arfalls.
Wilbur. Son of Ludvic. Linked to the faction, status undecided. Could be on the run from them? Hiding in the city?
Innkeeper of Phandalin is an informer. Informed them of Ludvic’s presence.

Goal §
Eliminate Target: Choose an undamaged rival Asset. If you destroy it within three turns, succeed at a Difficulty 1 goal. If you fail, pick a new goal without suffering the usual turn of paralysis.

Destroyed Zhentarim Asset Reserve Corps when creating new base in Neverwinter commercial district.


Overview / Ideas §
The head of the group, Klara, hates Ludvic.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Cryovain.title: Cryovain
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Cryovain.content:
He is afflicted by a necromantic affliction, due to his echo in a different worl becoming a dracolich, the dracolich Maurgadrith the Dracolich.
He is drawn to the region of Phandalin because his instinct tells him that here is present a way to stop the affliction. What is it?
He took control of the Orc Tribe to help him find this cure.
Affliction §
He is constantly sickly looking, but this doesn’t diminish his power. His white scales all have black capillary-looking webs on him. Eyes are almost completely white. His teeth have constant loss of blood from the base. He has some undead resistencies or traits.
As a regional effect, necromantic energy flows in the region, augmenting the undeads or giving similar resistencies to live animals and people.
Resolution §
2 main ways the PCs can fix the region:


Kill the Dragon


If they do, he will become a dracolich immediately, grabbing a few objects from his hoard to become the phylactery and flying away. A mage NPC will then explain them about the link with the echo in a different world. A planar adventure to kill the original dracolich could start.


Help him find the cure, maybe obtaining his support or promise to leave the region


The cure can be a spell ritual to sever the link with that echo, maybe placed in a long forgotten ruin or dungeon. This object or knowledge is actively searched by the , to impede to Cryovain to get away from lichdom.

Asset Die: d6

Rules: Coterie Faction System

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Dwarven-Kingdom-.title: Morkyl the Undead Dwarf
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Dwarven-Kingdom-.content:
Overview:
A dwarven cleric that died at Dwarven Excavation and was found by the PCs in a feral state.
He had to become a cannibal after being buried with its companions and deeply regret that.
He helped the PCs in there and returned to Nulbuzar after that.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Maurgadrith-the-.title: Maurgadrith the Dracolich
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Maurgadrith-the-.content:
Overview §
This is the Dragon planary linked to Cryovain, giving him his necrotic aura.
He is in another plane, maybe the shadow plane? I could use something from Planebreaker if available when I need it.
A adult black dragon turned dracolich recently.
Appearance §
TODO
Current actions §
Not important at the moment. The link with Cryovain was not his intention when becoming a dracolich.
For now his involvement will be limited.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Gera.title: Gerard
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Gera.content:
Accountant and merchant of Neverwinter.
Operates a front accountant firm for the Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction.
Ex boss of Ludvic.
Quite old now, his son Hugo is keeping the activity running.
He passes his time there, mostly seated, helping with his experience.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Gimd.title: Gimduhr Strongale
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Gimd.content:
Dwarf refuge from Nulbuzar
Personality: Well spoken
Background: Pursued, Travel.
Motivations: Create x2
Miner with some experience in stone masonry. He will work for the PCs at the guild hall.
Translating book on Vaults and Portals.
He has the book regarding

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Jadr.title: Jadrirk
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Jadr.content:
Owner of the Running Goblin magical shop.
Personality: Emotional, Honest
Appearance: Elaborate tattoos covering his face

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Katr.title: Katrina
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Katr.content:
Daughter of Ludvic, works as an employee of a spice shop.
She is secretly the owner of said shop, which is a front for the Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction to recycle money.
Wants §

Revenge on the city for its corruption and lack of possibility for women, in agreement with her mother Klara.

Knows §

 Shadowcloaks HQ location.
 Wilbur has fled the Shadowcloaks and is hiding just outside the city, but unsure where.
[ ]

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Klar.title: Klara
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Klar.content:
Ex wife of Ludvic. Now leader of the Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction.
Demeanor: Ruthless.
Appearance: 50 yo, not threatening looking, doesn’t go around heavily armed.
Job Training: Housewife turned manipulative crimelord
Motivation: Revenge against the societal system and patriarchy for her role of housewife and marginal importance in Ludvic life, which brought the marriage to die.
Flaw: Selfish. She is using the Shadowcloaks mainly to bring chaos to the city and the Neverwinter Government.
She is not a good fighter, but has some Zhentarim bodyguards.
She thinks Ludvic didn’t give her enough value, for this reason she didn’t push to keep the marriage.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Lady.title: Lady Masah Dankhud
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Lady.content:
Ancient Lady of Neverwinter Government.
Buried in Dragon Barrow after dying in defeating the green dragon.
Due to the latest necrotic energy issues in the area, her body has been animated as a ghoul against her will. She is a banshee now in stats.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Qiao.title: Qiao Peing
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Qiao.content:
Noblewoman of Family Peing of Neverwinter.
Let the PCs pass inside the quarantine zone.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Sera.title: Seraphina de Bernai
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Sera.content:
Leader of the Order of the Gauntlet.
Demeanor: Brave
Appearance: Scarred (A dead white eye with a big scar radially from there, due to a fireball years ago), high and with big build. Always in high uniform. Around 50 yo, white long hairs,
Job Training: Knight fighter.
Motivation: Protect the Order and let it thrive
Flaw: Tactless and very direct in talking, even if talks well
Social Background: Comes from a commoner family. Did career in the Neverwinter townguard and in the Order.
Economic Status: Upper Class thanks to its role.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Tori.title: Torian Firgon
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Tori.content:
Second in command of the Order of the Gauntlet.
Demeanor: Passionate and impulsive.
Apearance: Muscular human with a rancorous look all the time.
Job training: Woodworker before joining the Order.
Motivation: Give more control to the Order in the local politics. Prove his descendance from Lady.
Flaw: Obsessive. Subordinates know about his obsession with perfection on the uniform and the punishments that he gives for any minor imperfection. “The only moment when you are allowed to dirt your uniform is during a fight for the Order!”
Social Background: Originally an orphan, discovered being a descendant of Lady Masah Dankhud while in the Order.
Economic Status: Upper class due to status, but doesn’t dabble much in political games.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Wilb.title: Wilbur
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Wilb.content:
Son of Ludvic.
Not in good relationship with father, got thrown out years ago.
Currently in hiding after helping the Order of the Gauntlet against the Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction.
Personality: Impulsive and Hot-headed.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Yore.title: Yorelor
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Yore.content: textile merchant half elf in neverwinter

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Zeph.title: Zephaniah Guiffart
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Neverwinter/Zeph.content:
Important person of the Zhentarim in Neverwinter.
Officially it is a bureaucrat of the Office of Public Contact for the Council, will be the main contact if the players will want to go to Castle Never , they will speak with him.
Living in Protector’s Enclave.
Demeanor: Pious man with a pretty calm way of speaking.
Appearance: Pale and bald, with no facial hairs whatsoever.
Job Training: Bureaucrat at Castle Never.
Motivation: Become a leader of the people.
Flaw: Unwilling to share.
Social Background: Merchant - The character’s parents were merchants and have many contacts within that realm.
Goal §

 Remove PCs’s threat from the table
 Destabilize city
 Maintain relationship with Shadowcloaks Coterie Faction

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Halia-.title: Halia Thornton
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Halia-.content:
Overview §
Halia is a calculating human woman.
She is also an agent of the Zhentarim, a shadowy organization that seeks to exert secret control over the North through wealth and influence. Halia is working slowly to bring Phandalin under her control, and she can become a valuable patron to adventurers who don’t cross her.
Zhentarim hopes to gain control after the demonic invasion collapses on itself after conquering the cities, as usual.
Appearance §
Energetic and always busy, she is 45 years old, slim with very short brown hairs, with some traces of white. Brown eyes, worker hands.
She is quite frank and doesn’t lose time on appraisals to miners. No discounts to anyone.
Current actions §
She has paused Exchange operations to help the Cult of Dispater in shipping materials for the next few months.
If she suspects of PCs, she will alert the Cult to kill them.
She has been arrested by the PCs and given to Phandalin’s Mayor Harbin Wester

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Harbin.title: Harbin Wester
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Harbin.content:
Coward mayor of Phandalin.
Was under control of Cult of Dispater for a while but the PCs freed him along with the town.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Sinlen.title: Sinlen Dublis
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Sinlen.content:
Gnome merchant friend of Madrick Rootmuncher, Goliath Barbarian, originary of Gnomengarde.
Currently managing the Miner’s Exchange.
Can provide simple utility magic items.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Xanlok.title: Xanlok the Tortle Wizard
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/Phandalin/Xanlok.content:
Overview §
A travelling Tortle wizard, currently stopped in Phandalin’s tavern. He is researching these necrotic weaves.
He is original of the Material World from Maurgadrith the Dracolich and is searching for a way to cut the link with Cryovain. He will not share this with PCs at the beginning.
Appearance §
A very old tortle. He is super calm and slow speaking.
He has a worn robe with a hole on the back for its shell. Many small bags hang from himself, from many of them ingredients can be found peaking outside in small glass bottles. He walks with a wooden cane, crudely worked by magic in impossible spiralling and moving shapes for normal wood.
Current actions §
Searching for ingredients for his research in planar connections.
Can be a counsellor for all arcana stuff.
If asked to help finding the object to cure Cryovain, he can point to the spot into the Neverwinter Woods after asking to investigate these Dragon Hunters. If already doing it, asks to resolve that issue first.
Puppet is called d’Nesh.

D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/The-Nameless,-Wa.title: The Nameless, Warforged Druid
D&D-Campaign/World/NPCs/The-Nameless,-Wa.content:
Appearance: §
A construct of 2 meters high, composed mostly of wood and stone. There are dwarven runes all over the stone plaques.
He has a curved body, akin to that of an old man, using a wooden cane to walk.
There are horns of some kind of animal origin and 4 glowing green eyes, each one moves independently.
Story: §
He is a druid which was created in the city of Nulbuzar a few centuries earlier. After many years of hard work as assistant to a master smith, Thordan Brightstand. He was set free into the world, thanks to the friendship he developed with Thordan.
After many years of travel, he discovered his link with nature and a druidic circle in the Neverwinter Wood forest. With time, he managed to become a member of this circle and since then he travels and protects the Phandalin region, keeping the natural balance.
His hollow tree house can be created in a few hours by chanting to a tree. The tree will return to normal if the spell is dispelled by him.
His name is Molder, but he chose to not use it, a symbol of a previous life. He still has not decided on a new name.
Clues & secrets: §
When talking with the PCs, he will talk about his story but also the fact that the natural energies have been disrupted by the white dragon. He already experienced the magical energies of dragons in the past, but this is much stronger than it should be.
He senses a very unnatural energy coming from it.
A few hours ago, a magical wave passed through the area, raising deads animals in many places. “What has been already preyed upon, should not be preyed again!”

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.title: Domains of Neverwinter
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.content:
Kingdom Level §
Borders:
North with Technomancy of Aziria
South with Kingdom of To’kar
East with Vritus Empire (maybe no direct border)
Capital: Neverwinter
Second city: Arfalls
Other cities:

Phandalin
Gnomengarde
TBD near resources or good positions.

If no resource, can be trade hub, military stronghold, religious center, industrial center. Try to make a production chain toward big cities.



Government §
Medium density, not much control outside of main cities.
Rulers: Group of approximate equals, called The City Council of Neverwinter
Ruling Class: Nobility and rich merchant houses.
Source of Legitimacy: Brought prosperity to the land (inventor of plant magic was first of rulers?)
Agents of Control: Hireling enforcers hired as needed
Rulership structure: Oligarchs with wealth and influence
Current struggle inside government: Popular discontent is destroying legitimacy, due to overly focused magical research, removing resources for population.
Enemies of ruler §

Plant Supremacists TBD: trying to destabilize Neverwinter with magical terrorist attacks.
Demons of the Rift: trying to cut supply lines to Kingdom of To’kar.
Zhentarim: in the process of corrupting one of the oligarchs

Additional government info §

Current rulers stability: Outsider with few allies. One of the oligarchs has just been elected from a merchant house and needs to establish its respect.
Ministers issues: Out of touch with population
Strength: A spymaster serves well, quelling most revolts by targeted assassinations and by providing intel.
Stability: Pretty stable and legitimate, minus the terrorists.
Officials causing problems: Bribe-hungry magistrates, especially middle level ones.
Recent event: After a great revolt in Neverwinter, the bread taxes were lowered.

Current National problem: Luxury and technological research has left the nation’s coffers bare.
Good things happening now: A powerful artifact is helping the ruler.
National themes: Violence and Enlightment.
Violence due to terrorist attacks, Enlightment due to magical research.
Faction wars are ongoing and reaching also rural areas.
Current problems of the kingdom §

Cryovain destabilizing the south, low prio.
Popular malcontent building up due to rise of taxes, guards are getting violent.
Terrorist attacks of the Plant Supremacists TBD. Several went through with civilian victims recently.
Refer to upper part for more hooks.

History events §
A big city-state and the influenced lands which are spending big on knowledge while losing the general population to gang wars and other crimes in organized groups.
- Historical events:
- Desolation: A portion of territory was rendered inhabitable. Swamps in the south were created by a secessionist group, which later became Plant Supremacists TBD
- Secession: the Plant Supremacists TBD removed the swamps
- Golden Age: Growth period after discovering the plant imbution magic.
- Poverty: Due to collapse of infrastructure outside of Neverwinter, which led to poverty everywhere.
- Freakish Magic: Particular type of magic developed here. Art of imbuing plants with magical energy to let them produce magically charged fruits, each with different uses. Now it has been abandoned, but some practicioners are still found.
- Xenophilia: A lot of cultural influence is happening from the Technomancy of Aziria and their architectural style.
Wastelands §

Neverwinter Woods
Near Sword Mountains
TBD

Ethnic groups §
Neverwinter is quite cosmopolitan and the oligarchs are of various races.
A sizeable group are the dwarves refugees from Nulbuzar. They largely refuse to say what happened, only saying that a civil war is ongoing and they fled. They consider the situation to be an extreme shame on themselves due to ruining their ancestor’s home and consider themselves not worthy of returning.
They live in a specific area of the city, called Dwarven District or Nulbuzar directly. Even if they are grouped, there are no major conflicts or discriminations with the other ethnicities, being the city cosmopolitan.
Society §
Looks §
Old Neverwinterians

Curled, light browns hairs
Pale to Olive skin tone
Pale green eyes
Smaller and slighter than average
Used to wear family jewelry in public

Culture §

Value education and knowledge as source of power.
Cunning and ability to trick others
Discipline and obedience to the Council

Organization §
Trade guilds specific for each sector
Aesthetics §
Standard Medieval Europe.
Local gods and religious traditions §

Lathlander as good of farming and family growth.


Relationships §
Technomancy of Aziria §
Overview: Commercial dependent
Needs: Keep friendly relation to obtain aid with Gravity Crystals.
Neverwinter is trying to reproduce the crystals without success, spending all coins on it. They hope to obtain
Vritus Empire §
Overview: Tense due to imperialistic approach.
Needs: Keep losing the war to lower their power, militarily and economically.
No bad relations officially, but Neverwinter is trying helping Aziria with targeted sabotage.
Kingdom of To’kar §
Overview: Friendly.
Needs: Aid their protection duty against the Demonic Rift.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.title: Neverwinter
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.content:
Major city on the Sword Coast.
It controls the entire region, comprised Phandalin.
Governed by Neverwinter Government.

Districts & Important places §
Castle Never §
Castle Never.
Blacklake District §
Merchant quartier, attached to the docks
The Running Goblin §
A merchant of magical items, managed by the goblin Jadrirk.
Protector’s Enclave District §
Rich quartier of the nobility. TODO

Inn: The Left Pegasus, young human owner. Good quality tavern.

River District §
Other middle class quartier.
The Chasm District §
The Chasm is a recent development, caused by a group of undead mages that in an attack managed to open the earth. They were repelled, but broke some of the walls. The Chasm district, as the new name of the old Beggar’s Nest district, has been invaded by undeads and now the majority of the townguards fight street by street to keep it clean.
Hooks §

The undeads in the Chasm enter from outside the city, through some destroyed walls on the perimeter. Trying to reach those holes and close them would be appreciated by multiple people.
The undead mages are still in the district, sometimes they are spotted hunting inhabitants. Undead Mage
Some of the poor inhabitants are not admitted outside of the quarantined district. Some acts of rebellion are brewing towards the rich Protector’s Enclave District.

Other POIs §
House of Knowledge §
Moonstone Mask §
Some kind of wizard’s tower?
Pirates’ Skyhold §
An old pirate base, a tavern is there, of bad taste.
Factions §
Main location of Zhentarim, Order of the Gauntlet and Shadowcloaks Old Faction Sheet.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.title: Phandalin
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.content:
Overview §
A small mining town near Neverwinter of recent re-founding.
Community tags §
Type: Rural village
Who runs it? An elected mayor
Significant locals: Mayor Harbin Wester, Innkeeper, Wizard Xanlok the Tortle Wizard
Current pressing problem: Cryovain presence
Tags §
Recent Brutality p182
Awkward Birth p173
Locations §
Miner’s Exchange §
Currently managed by Sinlen Dublis.
Was Zhentarim base of operations, managed by Halia Thornton.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.title: Ancient Battlefield
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.content:
Overview §
The location is currently dormant, recharging necrotic energy from Cryovain. There is a magical device that automatically revives near corpses to zombies and skeletons, some as elemental ones.
After receiving a necro wave, it is recharged and resurrects a few new ones.
Hook: §
They know that strange undeads are coming from the site of a ancient battlefield and are going to investigate.
Part 1: §
Once arrived there, if they make a 1-st or + level spell, the spell is wasted and the energy recharges the object, which resurrects 2 skeletons, 2 zombies and 1 ogre skeleton around the battlefield.
If nothing happens, after a while a wave arrives and activates it.
The elemental splats around the place are being done by the book, an after effect of the summonings and broken device. If touched, they give 1d10 damage of the corresponding element. Purple is necrotic.
After that, each turn the book will randomly  resurrect something. Explain how this works.
Which PCs volunteers to focus on this? Probably Ludvic.
At round start, a PC can focus on it by standing on the same square and using its action to try to do a skill check, they can propose anything.
Hidden 1d100 at start of round.
(smaller zombies as groups in single token)
0-20: 1d4+3 zombies
21-40: 1d4+3 elemental zombies
41-60: 1d4+3 skeletons
61-80: 1d4+3 elemental skeletons
81-90: 1d2+1 ogre skeleton or minotaur skeleton
91-100: Bone Golem
On second turn, the minotaur skeleton is resurrected.
Special ability of enemies:
kamikaze.
Autodestruction, 10ft radius, 2d6 elemental damage based on type. Dex save for half.
Ranged elemental bolt, 1d8 damage, 60ft radius
Mines: Ranged action, place an elemental mine in a 60ft radius. Can be detonated as reaction, 10ft radius, 2d8 damage and prone. Dex save for half and negate prone
Solution:
Before activation:
Perception DC 20 to see a big book laden in hide and with a metallic corners and a metal skull on its center, of purple color with Common runes carved on it, in the hands of a heavily damaged skeleton wizard (according to the fluent and destroyed clothes)
After activation:
They notice a big book laden in hide and with a metallic corners and a metal skull on its center, of purple color with slightly glowing Common runes carved on it, in the hands of a heavily damaged skeleton sorcerer (according to the fluent and destroyed clothes).
To deactivate permanently:
Skill challenge, 5 checks, needs at least 3 successes. Each check requires an action, so will take minimum 3 turns.


Arcana DC 12 to manipulate its latent magic to quell the object and read in it to 


On fail, hands animate all around the battlefield, becoming difficult terrain for all PCs. No effect on other undeads.


Strength DC 12 to try to close the book, which will still continue to pour magical energy exiting it, but will lower the volume for a bit.


On fail, this will resurrect the minotaur skeleton due to the energy now not escaping as much now. Roll a fake 1d100 hidden, just to fuck with them.


Investigation DC 12 to study the object and decypher the runes to search for a way to stop it.


On fail, a bolt of energy escapes towards one of the other PCs. Roll +5 to hit. Dexterity Saving DC 13 to half 2d8 necrotic damage to the one targeted.


Performance DC 12 to use magic in music to quell the object.


On fail, another simple zombie is evoked.


History DC 12 to recall info on this object or battle and to know about a way to deactivate it.


A spell could also help or hinder them, depends on what is used.
On success:
The book stops animating the dead. Inside can be found the spell Animate Dead.
The book will be useful to Xanlok the Tortle Wizard to pinpoint precisely the artefact position and how to reach there. They will also have a mental image of a dwarf with the artefact on its head (its a crown). No context is given, but will point to Nulbuzar.
Rewards:

Animate Dead, Speak with Dead spells. Look at others higher level related to undeads.
around 1000 gp of jewels.

On fail:
The book continues animating deads for a while. If they flee with the book, some undeads will spawn sometimes during travel (handle in theather of the mind). The tortle wizard will contact them with Message to let them know to come to Phandalin if they want to fix their “literary problems” with a slow and calm voice.
After meeting with him, they will have the spells and the book will be deactivated.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.title: Dragon Barrow
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Domains-of-Ne.content:
Hex: 319.215
Adv: Dragon Barrow Adv
Overview §
An overgrown old temple in the wilderness. Underneath it it’s hidden the real catacomb.
It’s an ancient burying place for the heroes of the battle of Ancient Battlefield against the green dragon Azdraka and its army.
Here they keep the Dragon Slayer Longsword. A +2 Longsword with 3d6 slashing damage extra against dragon types.
Her body has been recently reanimated by the waves and has spent all the time laying traps and controlling other bodies in the tomb. She wants her body returned to normal or destroyed.
Temple §
On arrival:

Nestled in a forested area near the border of the battlefield, you found a weathered stone building with some columns on the side and an elevated platform.
In its center there is a big statue holding 2 marble plates of great dimension. The libra is unbalanced at the moment. Everywhere, vines are growing and moss is covering a good part of the statue. A damp smell of humidity can be felt. Behind the statue, from a small crease in the floor, you can see that the some sort of stair continues under it.

The statue is the key, they need to prove that they share the same values of rightousness and protection against dragons as the Lady.

On the statue an inscription says:
“This temple celebrates the life and death of Lady Masah Dankhud, Lady of Neverwinter and anathema to Azdraka the green dragon and his army of beasts. To meet her, stand on the plate and make her proud.”

They can either state their intentions, talk about the dragon or show a feat of strength against wild beasts.
The libra can also be destroyed. This will worsen all disposition of inhabitants.
- Staff of secrets will display an entrance under it.
- Detect Magic will also show the libra as magical.
If they waste time or say something offensive, 2 Elder Lizards will emerge from outside and attack. Once defeated, the statue will trigger.
- https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#elder%20giant%20lizard_tftyp x2
- Giant SkeletonUndead7TftYP
Catacombs §
On arrival:

Upon descending the stairs, you found yourselves in a long corridor with entrances on both sides. The air is heavy and smell of humidity and decay fills your nose. Some water drips from above making the only noise you can hear. The only source of light is the outside behind you, which illuminates only the first few meters of the corridor. On the first entrance on your left, a sound of fighting can be heard.

General Features §
Humid stone floor.
Ceiling with roots sticking between the stones and hanging down.
No lights, foul stench and heavy air.
All stairs are blocked by debris. Requires a strength check DC 13 or 1 hour of work to open. The stairs in the temple are permanently blocked.
Rooms §

Combat ongoing. A small shrine pierces one wall. A low altar, covered in mouldering offerings, burnt-down candles and the like, fills much of the niche. Faded paintings of an idealised afterlife of a winged woman in heavy armor, fighting a green dragon, adorn the niche’s walls.

A group of skeletons and specters are fighting each other, but none seems to be doing damage to the other. They are completely absorbed by the fight and don’t notice you. What do you do?


Empty room with some sarcophagi in it. “Upon entering, the group will hear the voice of a woman calling from room 4.”. On the tombs, the names of various “Champions of the Lady” are written. All tombs have been opened and are empty inside.
Bloodstains are all over the place, all dried up. Traces of burnt wood are in the center. Seems like here was a camp. No other traces of camp are there. A zombie is standing on the burnt remains, has a cowbell hanging from his neck. Stealth check DC 12 if entering normally.

Trap: A simple zombie has a cowbell attached to it. If it is alerted, the movement will call monsters from room 6. coming through the door.
If wraith is friendly, the zombie attacks normally, the wraith will help uselessly.


Room of Banshee Lady Masah. She will ask for help to the PCs. She is protected by a guardian if attacked.

She will explain that the buried here were brought back by magical waves, that keep them anchored to this world. She and other buried here have been awakened separated from their bodies, which have risen again under an independent will. No matter what, they can’t damage each other and are locked in an endless battle.
She will speak about a treasure as a reward for the destruction of her body.
She reccomends aquiring the Dragon Slayer Sword before going there. But they will need to be worthy of it.
“Upon entering you see what was probably a storage room of sorts. Barrels and crates fill the room, many broken by rotten wood.”


Trick. Hazard. Crumbling ceiling. Perception DC 13 to notice.

If noticed, “The ceiling here is weak and with roots coming out.” Pulling the roots or damaging it will open a path to surface.
On fail: 2d10 damange and exit uncovered.


Access to R3 is barred by a closed door.

A wraith is there. Will be hostile if the group is not friendly to the Lady or not met her yet.


Scriptorium of Recalling. An old library where the story of the battle is described. It mentions that the body of Lady Masah has been buried with the remains of the green dragon at the end of the long corridor, with the Dragon Slayer Sword and the Wand of Antigravity Room near there.
Pressure plate when entering the room (Perception DC 12). Portcullis drops and the room fills with eye-irritating gas. Constitution ST DC 13 or blind for 1 hour. Investigation DC 14 to see tripping wire, if searched

“Room has a small desk and some broken benches all around. Looks like some kind of social area, given the presence of old bottles, cups and small barrels for beer. Most of it is now dusty and ”

Among the broken things, 3x Greater Healing Potions,


Portcullis can be kept open without issues later.
Investigation result: After investigating the trap, it can be seen as something made with scraps findable in the area, mostly rotten wood and stone pieces crudely reshaped. The system


Sarcophagus with another Champion. In the room there are some other undeads. Champion is wearing a good quality Sigil of Neverwinter, made of silver. Rest of armor is damaged by time. 100 gp
Small chamber with a crown shaped altar dedicated to Aluvahin religion. “Let the blessing of To’kar be upon you”

If prayed upon, the altar will give immunity to 1 breadth attack.


Big landmark. The Strange Rock Cube.

On entrance “A big rock cube is hovering in place and slowing rotating on its axis. Inside it is a small wand and seems to contain an Axe of very good manufacturing. Some other objects around are also caught in the antigravity field. A yellow energy fills the room and some spectral life-sized images show the last moments of the battle. A figure next to the Lady has this wand in the hand pointed at some adversaries nearby, which are floating in mid-air, incapable of reaching them.”
The object is hard to reach and repels all creatures approaching it at less than 15ft. Objects can get near without issues. Mage Hand gets overcharged by the energy and fails.
Inside is the Wand of Gravity Removal. A wand that suspends gravity in 30ft radius, range of 60ft. No inversion, you can push people like in microgravity, 8 charges in total are still inside. At 0, it loses its power. Each use lasts 10 minutes.


An armor infused with a soul that can talk, called Hiedeh. The room has some alcoves on the side and some smashed wooden forniture. He has some cowbells, small bells and the rest around his belt, clinking while moving.

Wants the soul of the Lady to help the Body. Motivation: Jelous in life of her, wants to see her damned
If helped, will give informations on how to control the green dragon (false), using the Wand of Gravity Removal. Will give a small clear crystal where to store her soul.
If refused, it will attack. Maybe a golem made of objects in the room with the weapons and armors as the core. Component based creature that reforms each round and must be destroyed to reach the core and destroy it. CR 7 stats

AC 15, HP 120, Atk +7, Dmg 40, DC 14, Save 6

Current:


Armor 60 HP

Arms, Sword attacks, 20 HP + 20 HP
Chest Cannon, Hidden until first use, 10 HP. 30 ft line radiant energi, 2d10, Charge 5-6
Hearth, Critical, Hidden, 10 HP




The helmet is richly decorated and has a value of around 500gp. It still has some magical energy in it, but don’t seem to be of any usefulness.


Body of the Lady location with green dragon.

The Body will not talk, only wake up the dragon corpse and attack. The Body has a fixed maniac smile on her.
3000 gp, Sword of Dragon Slayer on Body.

ROOM DESCRTIPTION:
On the walls around the room, old paintings show the dragon sleeping in its lair, surrounded by gold. A text in Common in the lower part, near the treasure, says: “A reminder of the immense treasure of the dragon, most of which was used to help the City of Neverwinter repair the damages received.”


Dragon Stats (210 HP)

Description: “The dragon skeleton wakes up, its empty orbits looking at you. He is covered in a slimy substance that is all over the body of the dragon corpse, filling the places where flesh and scales once were as you look. A strong necrotic aura emanates from his body, the body of the lady repairing at the same time. The green substance slows its enveloping around the skeleton, taking the shape of green, shiny scales. His arms have big claws, dripping in poison”
COMPONENTS
Necromantic aura (heals at start of each turn all undeads + dragon 1d4 HD/ (1d4)d8 HP) (Dispelled by 40 radiant/fire energy or 80 HP for the rest. Healed by necrotic damage.)  13 fire / 13

~~Scale armor layer (hidden, revealed on first hit after aura) (50 HP)

Arms (10/10 HP, Melee with poison damage)
Tail (10 HP, 10 ft AOE Melee, Dex save DC 15 or prone)
Jaw (20 HP, Melee)
Breadth weapon (hidden) (10 HP, AoE Poison Cone 30 ft) 26 force

Hearth (Lifeblood, hidden) (10 HP) Discovered after slashing throat.










Architectural trick. Force field, perform or bring sacrifice to activate, On activation closes the entrance for 8 hours, forcing a long rest and restocking some of the rooms.

In the Room of the Weary Traveler, an altar of a exhausted man is resting near his sword. “Do you longe for rest, O traveler?” If one says yes, a force field will activated, blocking the exit for 8 hours. After that, some rooms will be restocked.


Copper Decapitated Statue. Conferring knighthood. Both the Lady and the Knight have been beheaded. On the walls, a list of names are carved, “Honoring the City and the Lady”.

Some specters are there, hostile if hostile with Lady.


Special Room. Written records. Content: Instructions on how to kill a dragon. It’s elemental resistance to poison, the breath weapon (poison 30 foot cone). Records of broken wing after the battle.

Notes §
TODO:

Create more traps in the overgrown temple building. Both normal traps, some ingenious ones and some triggers that attract nearby beasts if triggered.

Trap 1: Prison/Unleash. If triggered, imprisons who triggered it and does minor damage. skill check to free it. More of a gotcha than a real danger.
Trap 2: Horrible Stab. Classic spear trap.
Trap 3: Suppress Balance. Imbue Enemies. In a combat encounter place, if triggered give some buff to enemies. Maybe some normal zombies become exploding ones when killed in a 5ft radius.
Exploration encounter: Useful Armosphere. Roughly Fancy. A room where the sword is. If they try to take it, the body of the lady attacks.


Catacombs:

There are 2 factions: Spirits vs Undeads. Spirits are some of the companions of the Lady, the undeads are their bodies reanimated by Cryovain. They can’t hurt each other, so are in a perpetual war, dividing the catacombs in 2 sections.

TODO: make a version of each companion and decline powers in spirit and undead forms. Most of the dangers of the place are traps + eventual enemies they make.
Introduce faction war in the first room on the left “Monsters”. They are fighting each other, door is open. No damage is being dealt. They can intervene and choose a side or continue there. There will be no hostility at the beginning, all undeads and spirits are in good mind conditions.





One roll results §
How Old is it? Generations old.
100 yo
What do the locals think of it? They misunderstand what it really is
They only know about the surface temple.
How did it become ruined? Abandoned when it became useless
Increasing attacks from wilderness and forest let it become untenable to keep it safe without people living nearby.
Why not plundered yet? True entrance is unknown
Lady Masah wanted for the catacomb to be hidden, to avoid the sword being plundered by tomb raiders.
Which kind of ruin? Catacomb
Who used the ruin before? A garrison of local troops.
For a period a garrison from Neverwinter was keeping it safe from beasts, but was abandoned due to the remoteness from inhabited zones, which rendered it also not much frequented.
They were suddenly all killed one day 5 years ago, leaving the bodies all around the temple, which got people to avoid it.
Ruin Tags
Hidden Within p196

Royal Refuge p201

Important NPCs §
Lady Masah Dankhud §
One of the Ladies of the Neverwinter Government at the time. She led a party of companions to slay the dragon. She killed it, but was mortally wounded. She asked to be buried secretly near the battle site with the Dragon Slayer Longsword, as a way to keep away looters and unworthy people.
She is very angry about having her body running around, desacrated from her tomb.
The reanimated body of Lady Masah §
This zombie has placed a lot of traps in the temple and catacomb, plus some attraction devices to have beasts coming if triggered.
Has stats of Skeletal KnightUndead7DSotDQ
Double HP, add legendary resistance 3 times.
Legendary action init 20 for another Multiattack or do a Move without Attack of Opportunity.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Dwarven-Kingd.title: 0. General info
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Dwarven-Kingd.content:
History bits §
Each vault controls one of the doors to the city of Nulbuzar.
It was used to hold also training grounds and ritual coming of age ceremonies for young dwarves, which were meant to prove their adventuring capabilities to enter the higher ranks of military and politics in the city.
Now they have been activated in alert mode, unleashing all security functions to block access to the city to everyone.
Theme §
General theme: Constructs, magical devices, traps, trapped beasts

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Dwarven-Kingd.title: Nulbuzar
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Dwarven-Kingd.content:
Info can be found in Phandalin from a new wizard NPC (friend of the townmaster) that can point them to the dwarven city in the Underdark with a divination spell.
To enter it, they will need to unseal the gates. There are some vaults that can be used to unseal a gate. It’s going to be a construct and extraneous-creatures based encounters.
TODO:

 Define Unchained Mysteries - Investigation & Mystery prep for situation of the city.
 Define locations inside city (check settlement sheet, there are many already, move here)
 Keep the city small, no need to do an Urbancrawl. Define the Royal Palace as dungeon where to find the object of Cryovain.
 The political situation should be about suppression of rebels.
 The sentient whole object is something that is wore by the King of Nulbuzar, but made of two halves, like the crown of pharaos for high and low Egypt.

Updated Overview §
NPCs §
King Hortharn Mightkind, ex king, killed during coup attempt.
General Krumgus Gaar, executioner of the coup, has control of the city.
Thulmand Deepmantle, former viceroy, leader of current rebels.
The chaotic half of the object has influenced the General Krumgus Gaar to do the coup.
The lawful half of  the object is trapped inside the Royal Palace.
Central conflict §
King Hortharn Mightkind was xenophobic and cruel, but chosen by the people.
General Krumgus Gaar wants to let the city be tolerant, but forced everyone in a dictatorship.
Who do you choose?
Overview §
Background: §
An intelligent object (rod? Something simmetrical) was a neutral evil object with some mind controlling powers. It was broken in 2 pieces a few years ago by a group of drows. This caused the object to split its personality, one part is CE, one is LE alignment.
Both the objects were captured by a group of dwarves. Two of the bosses got gifted the objects as honour for the won battle against the drows but the objects got hold of them. They despise each other and can communicate telepathically in 30 feet to all intelligent creatures.
Posing as the original dwarves, they start a civil war a few months ago, still ongoing. No word of it has reached the surface yet, no one exits and they are insular city to begin with.
Present situation: §
PCs find the dwarven city with light security outside. Each faction is trying to conquer the entire city, each one has control on one of the gates of the city, which are small fortresses. The middle part is no man’s land, with dwarven refugees that try to survive and frequent skirmishes between the 2. The original kings were killed by the 2 factions.
PCs will encounter the chaotic faction first. A single dwarf which captured another of the legal faction, reay to be killed on the spot. They will explain their POVs and the PCs can choose if siding or become neutral and search the object.
The chaotic faction believes themselves as fighters for the freedom against a vile dictator.
The legal faction is convinced the others only want to make a coup and destroy the 2-king monarchy that was present until now.
Clues about the object:

Latest news in the local journal talks about a magnificent object found in the latest victory against the drows.
If they inquire about the object, no ones know where it is. If they speak with both bosses, they will notice that both are wearing or are near the object, which are specular and identical.
If they examine one of the objects, traces of being broken can be found. If they examine both, the connection is evindent.
Detect magic will show great magic potential on both objects. Ludvic will know they are intelligent after studying them closely. With a Perception DC 20, it can be seen that the object have the same style and their shape suggests they could be united.

Probable resolutions:

PCs side with one of the factions. They help them conquest some point of interest in the city, then look at how both faction treat survivors in the no man’s land without pity. After that, they will be asked to help conquest the base of the other faction. After defeating a faction, they will find one of the objects. Connecting the dots will be simple.
If they don’t side, the only way is to take possession of both objects. They will alert their slaves telepathically, they want their army.

In both cases, a ritual needs to be done to unify the pieces. The wizard in Phandalin can do it, otherwise the instructions can be found in the treasury with the other objects taken from the drows.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Kingdom-of-To.title: Kingdom of To'kar
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Kingdom-of-To.content:
Themes: Precarity and Unity. They are threatened by something and are keeping it at bay in a war state. (Linked to Milushi religion)
- Depravity: Debauches, unclean habits or hunger became commonplace.
- Evil Wizard: A single or group caused something bad.
Demonic Rift §
Relationships §
Technomancy of Aziria §
Overview: Friendly.
Needs: Gain airships to aid with Demonic Rift.
Neverwinter is trying to reproduce the crystals without success, spending all coins on it. They hope to obtain
Vritus Empire §
Overview: Tense due to imperialistic approach.
Needs: Stop war to free military support from Aziria for them.
Domains of Neverwinter §
Overview: Friendly.
Needs: More military support0.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Technomancy-o.title: Technomancy of Aziria
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Technomancy-o.content:
Themes: Despair and Legitimacy. Some looming problem is afflicting them but the rulers are supported and are maybe the only thing blocking the looming doom of the nation.
- History:
- Magical Tech: They invented something useful. Gravity crystals. Useful for flying structures and airships.
- Internal War: A civil war is ongoing or was present.
Relationships §
Domains of Neverwinter §
Overview: Commercial
Needs: Keep as commercial subordinate until they start to fold, then conquer as “saviors”. Increase instability with sabotage and covert propaganda.
Neverwinter is trying to reproduce the crystals without success, spending all coins on it. Aziria is keeping its tech a secret, building flying fortresses and using airships for far trade and commercial advantage thanks to speed.
Vritus Empire §
Overview: Open war.
Needs: With the casus belli, they are winning and gaining new lands.
The Empire tried kidnapping the court wizard inventor of the Gravity Crystals, failing. This started the war.
Kingdom of To’kar §
Overview: Friendly.
Needs: Keep as possible ally for protection.
No involvement yet in the war with Vritus Empire, but they can be pressured in joining if something goes bad.

D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Vritus-Empire.title: Vritus Empire
D&D-Campaign/World/Nations/Vritus-Empire.content:
Themes: Ignorance and Justice. A strange belief defines their culture. Its powers are also influenced, but remain fair in that view. Order of the Gauntlet originates from here?
- History:
- Praetorians Coup: Protectors of the rules ended up making a coup.
- Plague: A great plague almost destroyed the nation, it’s still present in some places.
Relationships §
Technomancy of Aziria §
Overview: War.
Needs: Gain knowledge about Gravity Crystals
Kingdom of To’kar §
Overview: Neutral.
Needs: Aid demons in Demonic Rift to keep kingdom busy and so cannot help Aziria.
Domains of Neverwinter §
Overview: Neutral.
Needs: Suspect of military support at Aziria.

D&D-Campaign/World/Region-of-Lyncor.title: Region of Lyncor
D&D-Campaign/World/Region-of-Lyncor.content:
Region Level §
Major geographical features §
2 sides have ocean.
Both 1 and 2 are the current Neverwinter region

Sword Coast
Sword Mountains
Rain Forest (near mountains, towards coast)
Grasslands / Plains
Farmlands
Canyon cut by rivers
Volcano
Swamp near a big delta river (close to grasslands)

Rivers §
4 with 2 big lakes

Neverwinter river


Major nations and groups §
Nations: page 124

Domains of Neverwinter
Kingdom of To’kar.
Vritus Empire.
Technomancy of Aziria.

Groups:

Zhentarim

History:

Golden Age: Prosperity and success as a merchant company thanks to the rare resource.
Rare resource: Was found or manufactured by the group, useful to them. Some magical crystal useful to Technomancy of Aziria tech?




Order of the Gauntlet

History:

Freakish Magic: A particular type of magic was developed and is unknown elsewhere.
Great Infrastructure: A great work was accomplished. A great flying fortress as HQ?




Demons of the Rift. The demons spawned at the Demonic Rift and fighting to conquer Kingdom of To’kar.

Regionally significant gods §
Aluvahin
Milushi

D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Aluvahin.title: Aluvahin
D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Aluvahin.content:
Neverwinter & To’kar
Leadership Structure
Domains of Neverwinter: Each holy person is autonomous leader of their own branch.
Kingdom of To’kar: Church is part of government structure. Clergy are gov functionaries.
God Origin: Apotheosized sorcerer called To’kar
Why does this faith matter? State faith (To’kar)
Faith wants… Erect a huge temple complex.
How is Clergy like? Ritual technicians trained in the rites, no moral specialty.
Their societal function? Prevents common disaster (To’kar)
God’s Portfolio? Justice
Which strictures? Taboo doing something specific.
Overview §
Religion born from the hero To’kar, which ascended to godhood while fighting in the Demonic Rift. It’s the official religion of the Kingdom of To’kar, from which it takes the name.
The fight against the demons is a duty for a Aluvahin follower.

D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Cult-of-the.title: Cult of the Traveler
D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Cult-of-the.content:
A small unstructured group of devotees to the Traveler, a god protector of travelers and voyagers.
They don’t have temples and are a very small group.
They usually build safe spaces for travelers, like trading posts and refuges. Also cabins for hunters and travelers, furnished with general needs.

D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Milushi.title: Milushi
D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Milushi.content:
Anlhacon & Sashidel
Leadership Structure
Pontiff with upper and lower clergy                                                                                                                   God Origin Personified natural phenomenon.
Why does this faith matter? Main purveyor of healing blessings
Faith wants… Depose a hostile royal house or gov.
How is Clergy like? Chosen from specific bloodlines/groups and trained to serve
Their societal function? Protector of ethnic minority
God’s Portfolio? Cosmic Law
Which strictures? Give a significant tithe regularly.

D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Savras.title: Savras
D&D-Campaign/World/Religions/Savras.content:
Forgotten god Savras, overtaken by Lathlander.
Was the god of farmers and growth.

D&D-Campaign/World/World-level-info.title: World level info
D&D-Campaign/World/World-level-info.content:
World name: Khasei §
Map Worldographer:
6 miles hex kingdom level. Continent is WWN Region level. No use of Province level.
Differing from our world? §
There are 2 moons, named: Arbah and Vahren.
Vahren is further out, but both are easily visible
Alternate dimensions §
Classical D&D planes. Elemental planes, Abyss, Celestia, etc…
Global scale empire or group §
The Zhentarim are a secretive group that tries to control world powers from behind the scenes. They use wealth and corruption to decide the fate of kingdoms and trigger wars for their ends.
Travelling ease §
Travelling can be dangerous and people rarely leave their immediate birth place.
Far traders do most of the news-spreading and diffusion of goods.
Some kingdoms are more connected than others though.
Recent history events §
Event 1: Natural disaster - 200 years ago §
Overcome by organization and unity.
A chunk of Vahren fell on Khasei. Today an asteroid belt orbit with the moon.
The nations and kingdoms stopped all wars and focused on helping each other. This event was known as The Rebirth or Khasei.
Event 2: Barbarian Invasion - 100 years ago §
Overcome by economic brilliance and trading acumen.
What happened to barbarians remnant? Split into several new, smaller groups.
Who are the barbarians? Orcs and goblinoids.
Why were they moving? Arrived from a different plane of existence.
Event 3: Enemies Within - 20 years ago §
Zhentarim are discovered publicly during a botched operation.
They are still secretive, but now the Order of the Gauntlet and the Harpers are born to hunt them.

Psionic Knives. Make thought into energy at will, forming an ENERGY melee weapon that can never be lost, detected or damaged. All psionic items of this nature can be used by you or your telekinetic presence
BASIC LOOT

ICRPG/Presentation.title: Presentation
ICRPG/Presentation.content:
ICRPG, a simplification of D&D
Modular system, there are advanced rules for PC advancement and Magic if you want more crunch.
Core rules

Playing in turns during exploration as well
Turn type
Actions
TARGET, easy/hard
EFFORT
Hearts
Movement/Distance
Time
Recovery
Hero Coins


PCs

Types as classes
PC = Ability + LOOT
Simple progression: Milestones and Mastery (quick description)
Magic: roll to cast system, all day long. Spell levels and mastery as optional advanced rules
